case.sTitle: A few small features for SiteManager

event.s:
Based on feedback from users and other stakeholders, we need to do the following small enhancements:
More prominently display the associated environment on the login screen. Some BAs have been unsure which of Staging vs Production that they have been logging into. 32pt bold red font will hopefully solve that problem.
Add a confirmation for uninstallation (as it is right next to the restart site button and could be the victim of accidental clicks)
Add in the ability to generate the F5 load balancer script
For developers, change the default build artifacts path to C:\BuildArtifacts.
event.sHtml:
Based on feedback from users and other stakeholders, we need to do the following small enhancements:

  • More prominently display the associated environment on the login screen.  Some BAs have been unsure which of Staging vs Production that they have been logging into.  32pt bold red font will hopefully solve that problem.
  • Add a confirmation for uninstallation (as it is right next to the restart site button and could be the victim of accidental clicks)
  • Add in the ability to generate the F5 load balancer script
  • For developers, change the default build artifacts path to C:\BuildArtifacts.

event.evtDescription: Assigned to Brock Bouchard by Brock Bouchard

case.sLatestTextSummary: We are experiencing performance issues with Kiln, and one of the pieces of feed back is that our Kiln server is seeing up to 15 requests per second. Scaling back the polling interval for the "Continuous Integration" template from 150 seconds to 10 ...
case.sTitle: Up default continuous integration polling time

event.s:
We are experiencing performance issues with Kiln, and one of the pieces of feed back is that our Kiln server is seeing up to 15 requests per second.
Scaling back the polling interval for the "Continuous Integration" template from 150 seconds to 10 minutes (600 seconds). Also making it configurable, so specific projects can set it to whatever the specific needs are.
event.sHtml:
We are experiencing performance issues with Kiln, and one of the pieces of feed back is that our Kiln server is seeing up to 15 requests per second.

Scaling back the polling interval for the "Continuous Integration" template from 150 seconds to 10 minutes (600 seconds).  Also making it configurable, so specific projects can set it to whatever the specific needs are.

case.sTitle: Change Sites web service to search by release fragment instead of full release name; make sites table sortable

event.s:
With Yggdrasil and SiteManager deployed in development, two related requests came in:
it was pointed out that searching by only the full release name is frustrating. We should change the Sites web service to search by a release name fragment instead.
We have lost the ability to sort on column headers in the sites screen
We should remedy both of these things.
event.sHtml:
With Yggdrasil and SiteManager deployed in development, two related requests came in:

  1. it was pointed out that searching by only the full release name is frustrating.  We should change the Sites web service to search by a release name fragment instead.
  2. We have lost the ability to sort on column headers in the sites screen

We should remedy both of these things.

case.sLatestTextSummary: On .16.58 I am experiencing problems whereby I wake up to find the CC.net service stopped. The scheduled windows task that runs BuildServerCleanup.bat, which in turn calls sc stop/start on CruiseControl.NET, seems to be exiting with error code ...
case.sTitle: Fix problems starting and stopping CC.net service in BuildServerCleanup.bat

event.s:
On .16.58 I am experiencing problems whereby I wake up to find the CC.net service stopped. The scheduled windows task that runs BuildServerCleanup.bat, which in turn calls sc stop/start on CruiseControl.NET, seems to be exiting with error code 0x420. This errors seems to be ERROR_SERVICE_ALREADY_RUNNING: http://www.pc-library.com/errors/error-code/1056-0x420/
What is likely happening is that sc stop returns before the stop actually happens, the subsequent sc start fails, then cc.net service finally stops.
We should tighten this up by introducing code to ensure that the service stops and starts, by waiting for each operation to complete.
event.sHtml:
On .16.58 I am experiencing problems whereby I wake up to find the CC.net service stopped.  The scheduled windows task that runs BuildServerCleanup.bat, which in turn calls sc stop/start on CruiseControl.NET, seems to be exiting with error code 0x420.  This errors seems to be ERROR_SERVICE_ALREADY_RUNNING: http://www.pc-library.com/errors/error-code/1056-0x420/

What is likely happening is that sc stop returns before the stop actually happens, the subsequent sc start fails, then cc.net service finally stops.

We should tighten this up by introducing code to ensure that the service stops and starts, by waiting for each operation to complete.

case.sTitle: Create Onus-based DataLoader.exe

event.s:
Summary
We need to create an Onus-based DataLoader.exe and NuGet package. This will accomplish the following:
Replace the CCC-specific DataLoader.exe, ensuring the CCC team is using the same load execution engine as CITADEL
Allow other teams to easily test the loaders they write against the Onus.Lib execution engine.
Attached is an example Onus console application and explanatory email from Vikas Agrawal, who worked on developing Onus.
Separate Onus Repository
Also done as part of this ticket was the creation of a separate Onus repository at:
https://fogbugz.devid.local/kiln/Code/Platform/Shared-Platform/Onus
This repository holds Onus.LoaderLib, Onus.LoaderLib and Onus.DataLoader.
We have also added Onus to the shared platform build configuration in:
https://fogbugz.devid.local/kiln/Code/Platform/Shared-Platform/PlatformBuildConfiguration
This allows for easy publishing of changes to Onus on the platform CC.net server:
http://192.168.16.58/ccnet/
Testing Instructions
Verify Onus compiles I guess. We need to get Onus unit tests created; I only had time to pull what was in the CDA source tree (and I did not see any Onus unit tests).
event.sHtml:
Summary

We need to create an Onus-based DataLoader.exe and NuGet package.  This will accomplish the following:

  • Replace the CCC-specific DataLoader.exe, ensuring the CCC team is using the same load execution engine as CITADEL
  • Allow other teams to easily test the loaders they write against the Onus.Lib execution engine.

Attached is an example Onus console application and explanatory email from Vikas Agrawal, who worked on developing Onus.

Separate Onus Repository

Also done as part of this ticket was the creation of a separate Onus repository at:

https://fogbugz.devid.local/kiln/Code/Platform/Shared-Platform/Onus

This repository holds Onus.LoaderLib, Onus.LoaderLib and Onus.DataLoader.

We have also added Onus to the shared platform build configuration in:

https://fogbugz.devid.local/kiln/Code/Platform/Shared-Platform/PlatformBuildConfiguration

This allows for easy publishing of changes to Onus on the platform CC.net server:

http://192.168.16.58/ccnet/

Testing Instructions

Verify Onus compiles I guess.  We need to get Onus unit tests created; I only had time to pull what was in the CDA source tree (and I did not see any Onus unit tests).

case.sLatestTextSummary: Goal Current Foreign Key generator uses all the values present in the parent table. However Andrew Kunzel wanted to limit the number of encounters to be used for "temp_cpoeorders" table. So we wanted a way to limit the number of values from parent ...
case.sTitle: Add "Take" parameter in Foreign Key Generator

event.s:
Goal
Current Foreign Key generator uses all the values present in the parent table. However Andrew Kunzel wanted to limit the number of encounters to be used for "temp_cpoeorders" table. So we wanted a way to limit the number of values from parent table.
Resolution
Add a "Take" parameter in Foreign Key Generator, This will control the number of value to be used from Parent table
event.sHtml:
Goal

Current Foreign Key generator uses all the values present in the parent table. However Andrew Kunzel wanted to limit the number of encounters to be used for "temp_cpoeorders" table. So we wanted a way to limit the number of values from parent table.

Resolution

Add a "Take" parameter in Foreign Key Generator, This will control the number of value to be used from Parent table

event.evtDescription: Assigned to Saurabh Agrawal by Saurabh Agrawal

case.sTitle: Umbrella : Data generation tool for creating developement/test database

event.s:
== GOAL ==
Come up with a data generation tool which will help to create the development/test database. Goal is to use same db for both development and testing purpose.
Currently we have separate database for development and integration test. The test database doesn’t contain enough data in all the tables to tests all possible functionality in our application. We use csv file to populate out test database. These csv files consume a lot of space in our source tree.
For development purpose we use member’s deidentified database which is cumbersome to maintain. Since each developer has its own copy of development database, there are inconsistency in terms of data. When a new developer joins in we need to provide him/her with a backup which is like 25-30Gb and not always up-to-date with the latest schema.
Past example: Sometime back there was a defect reported wherein if the number of groups exceeds more than 2100, electronic review module was failing. There is no way to test this scenario in current infrastructure.
== REQUESTING MEMBERS ==
NA
== FUNCTIONALITY INCLUDED ==
Data generation tool should provide below functionality
Ability to build fully functional dev/test database on a single click
Should generate data based on rules which can be defined by the developer
Should generate same data each time(seed based generation)
Should adhere to the integrity constraints defined in the database tables (e.g foreign key, null, unique key constraints)
In case of bridge table, should generate data to cover maximum possible scenarios. e.g a physician can belong to none or one or more specialty in a hospital.
Ability to define number of records which has to be generated for each table. Future goal is to use this tool for performance testing and integrate with our build server
There are few extract files which are common to all the member (e.g APRDRG,ICD9Codes etc..). We don’t need to generate data for these extract files as these can be directly used to populate tables in dev/main database.
== FUNCTIONALITY NOT INCLUDED ==
This data generation tool is purely for development team and not related to services in any way. However QA will be using this DB for manual testing.
== OPEN QUESTIONS ==
Any third party tool(open source or paid) which fulfills above requirement can be used for data generation purpose.
== TECHNICAL NOTES ==
TBD
== MIGRATION STEPS ==
TBD
event.sHtml:
== GOAL ==

Come up with a data generation tool which will help to create the development/test database. Goal is to use same db for both development and testing purpose.

Currently we have separate database for development and integration test. The test database doesn’t contain enough data in all the tables to tests all possible functionality in our application. We use csv file to populate out test database. These csv files consume a lot of space in our source tree.

For development purpose we use member’s deidentified database which is cumbersome to maintain. Since each developer has its own copy of development database, there are inconsistency in terms of data. When a new developer joins in we need to provide him/her with a backup which is like 25-30Gb and not always up-to-date with the latest schema.

Past example: Sometime back there was a defect reported wherein if the number of groups exceeds more than 2100, electronic review module was failing. There is no way to test this scenario in current infrastructure.

== REQUESTING MEMBERS ==

  NA

== FUNCTIONALITY INCLUDED ==

Data generation tool should provide below functionality

  1. Ability to build fully functional dev/test database on a single click
  2. Should generate data based on rules which can be defined by the developer
  3. Should generate same data each time(seed based generation)
  4. Should adhere to the integrity constraints defined in the database tables (e.g foreign key, null, unique key constraints)
  5. In case of bridge table, should generate data to cover maximum possible scenarios. e.g a physician can belong to none or one or more specialty in a hospital.
  6. Ability to define number of records which has to be generated for each table. Future goal is to use this tool for performance testing and integrate with our build server
  7. There are few extract files which are common to all the member (e.g APRDRG,ICD9Codes etc..). We don’t need to generate data for these extract files as these can be directly used to populate tables in dev/main database.

== FUNCTIONALITY NOT INCLUDED ==

This data generation tool is purely for development team and not related to services in any way. However QA will be using this DB for manual testing.

 == OPEN QUESTIONS ==

 Any third party tool(open source or paid) which fulfills above requirement can be used for data generation purpose.

== TECHNICAL NOTES ==

  TBD

== MIGRATION STEPS ==

  TBD

case.sTitle: Add operation level threshold support for profiling operations

event.evtDescription: Assigned to Kumar Vaibhav by Kumar Vaibhav

event.s:
Description & Requirement
Feature suggested by Brock.
The operations we will profile may not always correspond to code behind written for web pages that need to take less time. We may also need to profile code such as loaders, etc., which are expected to take some considerable amount of time(but only up to a certain limit). In such a scenario it will be good to have some definition for slowness per operation. This is the purpose of this feature. Now we can (optionally) write something like this -
using(perfLabs.Step(Profiler.xyzApproach("OperationName", 6000))
{
.....
.....
}
In this case, this operation is expected to take 6000 milliseconds. If it takes more than that then it will reported as slow. This is an optional parameter. If you don't specify it then the global definition of slowness, as specified in the Settings, will come into effect.
Code Changes Made(for this feature and some minor tweaks) -
1. Changing name of demo project from "Crimson Continuum of Care" to "Demo Project".
2. Adding tests for Operation level thresholds in the tests project.
3. Adding support for Operation level thresholds in StopWatchProfiler and extending mini profiler approach for the same.
4. Adding support for showing operation level thresholds in the performance
report.
5. Adding migration for schema changes for operation level thresholds.
Schema Changes -
1. Added table MiniProfilerOperationThresholds to capture threshold timings per operation. Entry to this is made after each operation is profiled.
2. Added column ThresholdOperationTiming in StopWatchProfilerTimings table to capture operation level thresholds for StopWatch approach. Entry to this is made after each operation is profiled.
event.sChanges: Developer changed from (None) to Kumar Vaibhav Tester changed from (None) to Brock Bouchard Code Reviewer changed from (None) to Brock Bouchard Status changed from 'New' to 'Resolved (Needs Review)'.
event.evtDescription: Resolved (Needs Review) and assigned to Brock Bouchard by Kumar Vaibhav
event.sHtml:
Description & Requirement
 
Feature suggested by Brock. 
The operations we will profile may not always correspond to code behind written for web pages that need to take less time. We may also need to profile code such as loaders, etc., which are expected to take some considerable amount of time(but only up to a certain limit). In such a scenario it will be good to have some definition for slowness per operation. This is the purpose of this feature. Now we can (optionally) write something like this -
 
using(perfLabs.Step(Profiler.xyzApproach("OperationName", 6000))
{
    .....
    .....
}
 
In this case, this operation is expected to take 6000 milliseconds. If it takes more than that then it will reported as slow. This is an optional parameter. If you don't specify it then the global definition of slowness, as specified in the Settings, will come into effect. 
 
Code Changes Made(for this feature and some minor tweaks) - 
 
1. Changing name of demo project from "Crimson Continuum of Care" to "Demo Project".
2. Adding tests for Operation level thresholds in the tests project.
3. Adding support for Operation level thresholds in StopWatchProfiler and extending mini profiler approach for the same.
4. Adding support for showing operation level thresholds in the performance
report.
5. Adding migration for schema changes for operation level thresholds.
 
Schema Changes - 
1. Added table MiniProfilerOperationThresholds to capture threshold timings per operation. Entry to this is made after each operation is profiled. 
2. Added column ThresholdOperationTiming in StopWatchProfilerTimings table to capture operation level thresholds for StopWatch approach. Entry to this is made after each operation is profiled.

case.sLatestTextSummary: This ticket reconstructs the "Sites" and "Deployment" screens in SiteManager to work against the Yggdrasil web service layer. We also need to revisit how the deployment code works: It's tightly coupled to the Yggdrasil/SiteManager model; I think ...
case.sTitle: Rebuild sites and deployment screen, improve deployment code

event.s:
This ticket reconstructs the "Sites" and "Deployment" screens in SiteManager to work against the Yggdrasil web service layer.
We also need to revisit how the deployment code works:
It's tightly coupled to the Yggdrasil/SiteManager model; I think the interface it exposes should speak the language of web deployment. For example, ask for a list of connection strings or app settings instead of passing aSite or SiteDefinition object and getting values from there.
More consistent use of dependency injection. Some types take in things like strings, which should just be parameters on parameters instead.
event.sHtml:
This ticket reconstructs the "Sites" and "Deployment" screens in SiteManager to work against the Yggdrasil web service layer.

We also need to revisit how the deployment code works:

  • It's tightly coupled to the Yggdrasil/SiteManager model; I think the interface it exposes should speak the language of web deployment.  For example, ask for a list of connection strings or app settings instead of passing aSite or SiteDefinition object and getting values from there.
  • More consistent use of dependency injection.  Some types take in things like strings, which should just be parameters on parameters instead.

case.sTitle: Add ability to manage environments

event.s:
Right now SiteManager can only manage its implicit environment that is set in its config file. This works for the most part, however in the case of promotion one might need to edit the target environment being promoted to (i.e. setting build artifacts path and environment credentials).
We should add a "manage environments" link in the footer of SiteManager to make this functionality available.
event.sHtml:
Right now SiteManager can only manage its implicit environment that is set in its config file.  This works for the most part, however in the case of promotion one might need to edit the target environment being promoted to (i.e. setting build artifacts path and environment credentials).

We should add a "manage environments" link in the footer of SiteManager to make this functionality available.

event.evtDescription: Assigned to Kumar Vaibhav by Kumar Vaibhav

case.sLatestTextSummary: Moving to Shared Platform project.
case.sTitle: Umbrella : Performance Profiling Tests Project

event.s:
GOAL
The goal is to come up with a performance profiling framework for the product. One of the hurting aspects about CCC is the fact that it is slow in many places. A slow web application is also a lesser used application. One of the first things to be done as part of Performance Labs project is to have a Unit\Integration Tests project in place, as explained below.
The motive of Performance Labs tests project is to profile the code base. The results of these tests will be persisted in a separate Performance database. Any regressions found will be reported through the mailing system to be configured with ccnet. This project will have two options for the developer to profile their code - either through mvc mini profiler or through averaging out the response time using the usual StopWatch approach. This is because mvc mini profiler gives many options that we can(and should want to) use to our advantage at some later point of time when we decide to go into very detailed profiling of our system. It gives us the option to profile web services, wcf services, normal C# code, ado.net calls, linq-to-sql calls, NHibernate calls, EF operations, ajax calls, finding duplicate queries and what not. One of the main advantages of profiling with it is that it automatically checks for db operations in the code to be profiled and gives us the functionality to store these results separately. This allows us to get a glimpse of what's wrong and where very quickly.
FUNCTIONALITY INCLUDED
1. Performace Labs tests project can be fired up at any point of time to check the performance of the system.
2. It will also have a separate ccnet task configured that will run the project at certain intervals. The regressions will be reported through e-mails.
3. It will separately show the db operaions that were automatically profiled when testing the code base. So regression analysis will be done on that as well.
4. Functionality to use either the mini profiler or the usual Stopwatch approach(more suitable when averaging out the response times).
FUNCTIONALITY NOT INCLUDED
Realtime performance logging through site usage is not included in this release. This will be part of upcoming releases.
OPEN QUESTIONS
What all code should be profiled?
TECHNICAL NOTES
To be discussed.
MIGRATION STEPS
To be discussed.
event.sHtml:
GOAL
 
The goal is to come up with a performance profiling framework for the product. One of the hurting aspects about CCC is the fact that it is slow in many places. A slow web application is also a lesser used application. One of the first things to be done as part of Performance Labs project is to have a Unit\Integration Tests project in place, as explained below.  
 
The motive of Performance Labs tests project is to profile the code base. The results of these tests will be persisted in a separate Performance database. Any regressions found will be reported through the mailing system to be configured with ccnet. This project will have two options for the developer to profile their code - either through mvc mini profiler or through averaging out the response time using the usual StopWatch approach. This is because mvc mini profiler gives many  options that we can(and should want to) use to our advantage at some later point of time when we decide to go into very detailed profiling of our system. It gives us the option to profile web services, wcf services, normal C# code, ado.net calls, linq-to-sql calls, NHibernate calls, EF operations, ajax calls, finding duplicate queries and what not. One of the main advantages of profiling with it is that it automatically checks for db operations in the code to be profiled and gives us the functionality to store these results separately. This allows us to get a glimpse of what's wrong and where very quickly.
 
FUNCTIONALITY INCLUDED
 
1. Performace Labs tests project can be fired up at any point of time to check the performance of the system. 
 
2. It will also have a separate ccnet task configured that will run the project at certain intervals. The regressions will be reported through e-mails. 
 
3. It will separately show the db operaions that were automatically profiled when testing the code base. So regression analysis will be done on that as well. 
 
4. Functionality to use either the mini profiler or the usual Stopwatch approach(more suitable when averaging out the response times).
 
FUNCTIONALITY NOT INCLUDED
 
Realtime performance logging through site usage is not included in this release. This will be part of upcoming releases.
 
OPEN QUESTIONS
 
What all code should be profiled?
 
TECHNICAL NOTES
 
  To be discussed.
 
MIGRATION STEPS
 
  To be discussed.

case.sLatestTextSummary: In a few places throughout Crimson code, I often use the .NET xsd.exe tool to generate a class from XML. I then write code to parse an object from the XML file, validating the XML along the way. This code is practically identical in all projects, ...
case.sTitle: Create class for parsing objects from Xml based on .NET xsd.exe feature

event.s:
In a few places throughout Crimson code, I often use the .NET xsd.exe tool to generate a class from XML. I then write code to parse an object from the XML file, validating the XML along the way. This code is practically identical in all projects, so I think we should add it to commons.
The class is called ObjectXmlParser<T> and can parse in one of two ways:
1. Getting XSD implicitly from an embedded schema resource. By convention the resource is expected to be in the parsed type's assembly, and have a name match that matches the fully qualified type name of the parsed type with ".xsd" added at the end.
2. Getting XSD explicitly from a file.
event.sHtml:
In a few places throughout Crimson code, I often use the .NET xsd.exe tool to generate a class from XML.  I then write code to parse an object from the XML file, validating the XML along the way.  This code is practically identical in all projects, so I think we should add it to commons.

The class is called ObjectXmlParser<T> and can parse in one of two ways:

1. Getting XSD implicitly from an embedded schema resource.  By convention the resource is expected to be in the parsed type's assembly, and have a name match that matches the fully qualified type name of the parsed type with ".xsd" added at the end.

2. Getting XSD explicitly from a file.

case.sTitle: Re-styling of Performance Report

event.evtDescription: Assigned to Kumar Vaibhav by Kumar Vaibhav

event.s:
Description
The following changes were made to the existing report. Note that some of the changes were pushed as part of other tickets but overall, the following functionality is available as part of this ticket -
1. Clicking on the name of the regression operation will open up a modal that will have all the necessary information explaining the reason for regression.
2. Report name that contains the name of the Product has been made configurable so that different products could configure it with their respective product names.
3. Clicking on 'Has Sql Timings' link will now not only take the user to the query but will also highlight the query heading for about 6 seconds before fading away. Some jquery magic there.
4. The values of the configurations in the Demo project have also been changed to reflect real scenario values - Regression threshold changes from 3 to 1.5, anything taking more than 5 seconds shall be reported as 'slow'(more on this later), multiplication factor that reflects spike between the latest and penultimate values has been changed from 20 to 5.
5. All columns names have been changed to be more human readable now.
The reporting of slow operations has been as is, for now, because of the upcoming 'show and tell'. This will not be an issue because a ticket https://fogbugz.devid.local/default.asp?53193#253718 to add thresholds per operation has been added and would be done as part of 08 and on priority, right after setting up the servers. Hope that's fine.

event.sHtml:
Description

The following changes were made to the existing report. Note that some of the changes were pushed as part of other tickets but overall, the following functionality is available as part of this ticket - 

1. Clicking on the name of the regression operation will open up a modal that will have all the necessary information explaining the reason for regression.

2. Report name that contains the name of the Product has been made configurable so that different products could configure it with their respective product names.

3. Clicking on 'Has Sql Timings' link will now not only take the user to the query but will also highlight the query heading for about 6 seconds before fading away. Some jquery magic there.

4. The values of the configurations in the Demo project have also been changed to reflect real scenario values - Regression threshold changes from 3 to 1.5, anything taking more than 5 seconds shall be reported as 'slow'(more on this later), multiplication factor that reflects spike between the latest and penultimate values has been changed from 20 to 5.

5. All columns names have been changed to be more human readable now. 

The reporting of slow operations has been as is, for now, because of the upcoming 'show and tell'. This will not be an issue because a ticket https://fogbugz.devid.local/default.asp?53193#253718 to add thresholds per operation has been added and would be done as part of 08 and on priority, right after setting up the servers. Hope that's fine.

event.sHtml: Moving to Shared Platform project.

event.s:
Features Added
1. A sample project to profile has been added. It has some C# code, some ado.net code and also a sample database. This database is created and initial seeding done whenever the below mentioned NUnit test project is fired up. This database is deleted once all the tests have run.
2. A Nunit test project has been added to test the application. The conventions followed to name the test and name the test files have been mentioned in the ReadMe.txt file which is part of code base. This file is also attached with this ticket. Essentially, the test methods will follow this convention -
[MethodNameUnderTest_StateUnderTest-LikeWhatInput_ExpectedBehavior]
and test files will follow the pattern -
[NameOfTheClassUnderTestTests]
3. As part of this effort a lot tight coupling between db queries and html generation code in the PerformanceResult class has been removed. Also more ValueObjects were added to capture results in a better way.
4. Also, a Test Database called Test_PerformanceLabsDB will be created when tests are fired. This will be used for integration tests. This database also gets deleted once all the tests have been run. For this
5. Initial tests - There are tests to test code regression by StopWatch approach and by mini profiler approach, tests for profiling C# code both by StopWatch approach and by mini profiler approach, db regression test method for mini profiler approach. The present tests cover all the StopWatch aspects(like running a code multiple times when a method is passed as argument). The upcoming tests will test all the aspects of report creation. These tests will be written once report creation is modified for better and more intuitive presentation. Also, there will be tests for NHibernate and EF calls. This will be done gradually.
Testing Instruction -
1. Compile the project.
2. Open Nunit.exe from References folder
3. Point the Nunit.exe to ..bin\debug\PerformanceLabs.AllTests.dll and run all tests.
All tests should be green.

The following corrections have been made
1. DemoEFCode and DemoNHibernateCode removed.
2. Reference to Test_PerformanceLabsDBContext removed Setup. Reference to DemoDBContext also removed.
3. References for MiniProfiler dll and EntityFramework also removed.
4. Setting up PerformanceLabs made more simpler in SetupTests.cs. Calls for SaveToDatabase() removed, calls to PerformanceResult's constructor and GenerateHtmlReport() also removed.
5. Ticket https://fogbugz.devid.local/default.asp?52984#251964 created for creating DAL
Additions to code(as part of previous two changesets) -
1. Naming of columns for html tables in the report has been corrected as suggested. Same naming has been done for various method calls throughout the nunit tests project, demo project and the framework itself.
2. Creation of a Ado.Net wrapper in PerformanceLabs framework to profile ado.net db operations which earlier needed a reference of the MiniProfiler's ProfiledDbConnection class(used for profiling ado.net calls). Going forward, NHibernate calls and other ORM calls would also also be profiled using overridden connection calls provided by the mini profiler and wrapping them as part of PerformanceLabs. Just a difference of a class name in the demo project and everything else remains same.

event.sHtml:
Changes Made - 

The following corrections have been made

1. DemoEFCode and DemoNHibernateCode removed.

2. Reference to Test_PerformanceLabsDBContext removed Setup. Reference to DemoDBContext also removed.

3. References for MiniProfiler dll and EntityFramework also removed.

4. Setting up PerformanceLabs made more simpler in SetupTests.cs. Calls for SaveToDatabase() removed, calls to PerformanceResult's constructor and GenerateHtmlReport() also removed.

5. Ticket https://fogbugz.devid.local/default.asp?52984#251964 created for creating DAL

Additions to code(as part of previous two changesets) - 

1. Naming of columns for html tables in the report has been corrected as suggested. Same naming has been done for various method calls throughout the nunit tests project, demo project and the framework itself. 

2. Creation of a Ado.Net wrapper in PerformanceLabs framework to profile ado.net db operations which earlier needed a reference of the MiniProfiler's ProfiledDbConnection class(used for profiling ado.net calls). Going forward, NHibernate calls and other ORM calls would also also be profiled using overridden connection calls provided by the mini profiler and wrapping them as part of PerformanceLabs. Just a difference of a class name in the demo project and everything else remains same.

case.sTitle: Move Onus to Shared Platform

event.s:
We should move the Onus source code into our Shared Platform...
https://fogbugz.devid.local/default.asp?W1508
... so that there is more transparency with the code and changes. We can also take advantage of the Shared Platform build server and configuration to more easily publish Onus builds.
The plan is to create a single Onus repository at:
https://fogbugz.devid.local/kiln/Code/Platform/Shared-Platform/Onus
This will include Onus.Lib, Onus.LoaderLib, and Onus.DataLoader. The latter is a generic DataLoader.exe tool that CCC had been building in a separate repository.
event.sHtml:
We should move the Onus source code into our Shared Platform...

https://fogbugz.devid.local/default.asp?W1508

... so that there is more transparency with the code and changes.  We can also take advantage of the Shared Platform build server and configuration to more easily publish Onus builds.

The plan is to create a single Onus repository at:

https://fogbugz.devid.local/kiln/Code/Platform/Shared-Platform/Onus

This will include Onus.Lib, Onus.LoaderLib, and Onus.DataLoader.  The latter is a generic DataLoader.exe tool that CCC had been building in a separate repository.

case.sLatestTextSummary: All child tickets are assigned to Brock for code review. I checked in no code under this parent ticket number.
case.sTitle: Umbrella: Introduce Members into Yggdrasil API and SiteManager

event.s:
Goal
We need to introduce the concept of "Members" into the Yggdrasil API and SiteManager. When this ticket is completed we'll have:
an IMembersWebService that is part of the Yggdrasil API exposing basic CRUD operations on Members
a MembersController in SiteManager accessible via URL; there should not yet be a publicly facing link in SiteManager navigation. The MembersController will consume the IMembersWebService. This controller will provide basic CRUD actions and views similar to SiteDefinitions.
"Members" Schema + Entity
We'll need a "Members" table in the Yggdrasil database. The schema should look something like the following:
MemberID (int) (primary key)
Name (nvarchar)
UserName (nvarchar)
Password (nvarchar)
Encrypting UserName and Password
We need encrypt the UserName and Password of the Member before storing it. There is a class in Crimson.Yggdrasil.Core called EncryptionHelper that we should use for this. This is how Yggdrasil encrypts sensitive values.
Automatically Creating Users
In talking to Luis and the IT team, they would like to avoid a skew of requests to create the users associated with Members. He thus suggested that when a Member is created or removed, the associated user be created via calls to various Windows APIs. We should attempt to implement this as part of the CRUD work here. Some outstanding questions/challenges I can think of:
How do we handle the creation of the Member.UserName property? Do we let users explicitly create it? Is it created based off of the Member.Name property? I ask because there will probably be some characters in the member name (e.g. spaces) that won't be allowed in the user name.
We need to consider writing code that will work for both local development and in our network environment. The former likely will not have a domain available, whereas the latter always will. Does the same API call work in both cases? Do we use some kind of #DEBUG check?
What happens when a member name or user name is edited? Do we edit the user name automatically? Can it make calls to the Windows API to edit the user name? Or we actually might want to hold off on solving this until we have members associated with sites... in that case we can't go switching the member name of deployed sites.
event.sHtml:
Goal

We need to introduce the concept of "Members" into the Yggdrasil API and SiteManager.  When this ticket is completed we'll have:

  • an IMembersWebService that is part of the Yggdrasil API exposing basic CRUD operations on Members
  • a MembersController in SiteManager accessible via URL; there should not yet be a publicly facing link in SiteManager navigation.  The MembersController will consume the IMembersWebService.  This controller will provide basic CRUD actions and views similar to SiteDefinitions.

"Members" Schema + Entity

We'll need a "Members" table in the Yggdrasil database.  The schema should look something like the following:

  • MemberID (int) (primary key)
  • Name (nvarchar)
  • UserName (nvarchar)
  • Password (nvarchar)

Encrypting UserName and Password

We need encrypt the UserName and Password of the Member before storing it.  There is a class in Crimson.Yggdrasil.Core called EncryptionHelper that we should use for this.  This is how Yggdrasil encrypts sensitive values.

Automatically Creating Users

In talking to Luis and the IT team, they would like to avoid a skew of requests to create the users associated with Members.  He thus suggested that when a Member is created or removed, the associated user be created via calls to various Windows APIs.  We should attempt to implement this as part of the CRUD work here.  Some outstanding questions/challenges I can think of:

  • How do we handle the creation of the Member.UserName property?  Do we let users explicitly create it?  Is it created based off of the Member.Name property?  I ask because there will probably be some characters in the member name (e.g. spaces) that won't be allowed in the user name.
  • We need to consider writing code that will work for both local development and in our network environment.  The former likely will not have a domain available, whereas the latter always will.  Does the same API call work in both cases?  Do we use some kind of #DEBUG check?
  • What happens when a member name or user name is edited?  Do we edit the user name automatically?  Can it make calls to the Windows API to edit the user name?  Or we actually might want to hold off on solving this until we have members associated with sites... in that case we can't go switching the member name of deployed sites.

case.sLatestTextSummary: There are some changes we should make to service layer lib to support CCC web services. Note that these are enhancements that are useful in general. When finding service layer types via the "XXXWebService" and "XXXDto" convention, also support an ...
case.sTitle: Changes to ServiceLayerLib to support CCC Web Services

event.s:
There are some changes we should make to service layer lib to support CCC web services. Note that these are enhancements that are useful in general.
When finding service layer types via the "XXXWebService" and "XXXDto" convention, also support an optional "VX" at the end of the type name, e.g. "MeasureWebServiceV0" or "PhysicianDtoV1".
Break up the endpoint configuration in WcfHost into more granular components. We'll need to this to configure the ServiceHosts created .svc files in an ASP.NET application.
Add support for handing parameter and return types that are collections of DTOs (i.e. IEnumerable<DtoType> and IDictionary<DtoType, OtherDtoType>. Right now, ServiceLayerLib does not detect this when generating code and the DTO types are used directly instead of the generated data contracts.
event.sHtml:
There are some changes we should make to service layer lib to support CCC web services.  Note that these are enhancements that are useful in general.

  • When finding service layer types via the "XXXWebService" and "XXXDto" convention, also support an optional "VX" at the end of the type name, e.g. "MeasureWebServiceV0" or "PhysicianDtoV1".
  • Break up the endpoint configuration in WcfHost into more granular components.  We'll need to this to configure the ServiceHosts created .svc files in an ASP.NET application.
  • Add support for handing parameter and return types that are collections of DTOs (i.e. IEnumerable<DtoType> and IDictionary<DtoType, OtherDtoType>.  Right now, ServiceLayerLib does not detect this when generating code and the DTO types are used directly instead of the generated data contracts.

event.evtDescription: Assigned to Brock Bouchard by Brock Bouchard

case.sTitle: Warnings as Errors: Adding stylecop targets to the project

event.evtDescription: Assigned to Kumar Vaibhav by Kumar Vaibhav

event.s:
Description
Stylecop can be helpful to identify warnings that might allow the gates to be left opened for logical errors. In view of this, stylecop targets are useful to turn warnings into errors.

event.s:
Hi Kumar,
It sounds like this ticket is really about two things:
1. Turning on compilation warnings to errors.
2. Turning on StyleCop, and turning style cop warnings into build errors.
The description and the title seem to mix the two up as one task.
Also, looking in the latest copy of the PerformanceLabsFramework, I don't see either of the two things in place. We should:
1. Incorporate the SharedProjectSettings.targets file into the PerformanceLabsFramework project in the Build\Targets Folder. You can do this by copying the file of the same name from CCC\Build, then manually adding a "<Import Project="$(SolutionDir)Build\Targets\SharedProjectSettings.targets" />" statement into the PerformanceLabsFramework.csproj file. I think we should definitely do this as this will turn compiler warnings into errors.
2. If you think it will add value to the code, and you have time to adjust rules and clean up violations, you could incorporate style cop. There is a new official StyleCop.MSBuild package in the official nuget package source that we should use.
When you have completed the work above, please create new code review; I have closed the old one.
Thanks,
Brock
event.sChanges: Status changed from 'Resolved (Needs Review)' to 'Assigned'.
event.evtDescription: Reactivated (assigned to Kumar Vaibhav) by Brock Bouchard
event.sHtml:
Hi Kumar,

It sounds like this ticket is really about two things:

1. Turning on compilation warnings to errors.

2. Turning on StyleCop, and turning style cop warnings into build errors.

The description and the title seem to mix the two up as one task.

Also, looking in the latest copy of the PerformanceLabsFramework, I don't see either of the two things in place.  We should:

1. Incorporate the SharedProjectSettings.targets file into the PerformanceLabsFramework project in the Build\Targets Folder.  You can do this by copying the file of the same name from CCC\Build, then manually adding a "<Import Project="$(SolutionDir)Build\Targets\SharedProjectSettings.targets" />" statement into the PerformanceLabsFramework.csproj file.  I think we should definitely do this as this will turn compiler warnings into errors.

2. If you think it will add value to the code, and you have time to adjust rules and clean up violations, you could incorporate style cop.  There is a new official StyleCop.MSBuild package in the official nuget package source that we should use.

When you have completed the work above, please create new code review; I have closed the old one.

Thanks,

Brock

Thanks,

case.sTitle: Database design and creation to support the storing of Stopwatch results

event.evtDescription: Assigned to Kumar Vaibhav by Kumar Vaibhav
Assigned to Kumar Vaibhav by Brad Thrift

event.sChanges: Developer changed from (None) to Kumar Vaibhav Tester changed from (None) to Saurabh Agrawal Code Reviewer changed from (None) to Brock Bouchard Status changed from 'New' to 'Assigned'.

event.s:
Description
Two tables - StopWatchProfilers as master table and StopWatchProfilerTimings as child table were created. When the profilers are started for a particular profiling session, then an entry is made to the master table.
After this whenever something would be profiled using the Stopwatch approach then an entry corresponding to the entry made in the parent table would be made in the child table.
Need for two tables
1. Keeping uniformity across database design for mvc mini and stopwatch approach.
2. All global settings will be going to the master table and are not needed in the child table.
3. Better tracking of specific profiling sessions.
event.sHtml:
Description

Two tables  - StopWatchProfilers as master table and StopWatchProfilerTimings as child table were created. When the profilers are started for a particular profiling session, then an entry is made to the master table. 

After this whenever something would be profiled using the Stopwatch approach then an entry corresponding to the entry made in the parent table would be made in the child table.

Need for two tables

1. Keeping uniformity across database design for mvc mini and stopwatch approach.

2. All global settings will be going to the master table and are not needed in the child table. 

3. Better tracking of specific profiling sessions.

case.sLatestTextSummary: When SiteManager deploys a site it should add the following <appSetting> keys to the Web.config file: Properties related to the location of the Yggdrasil service (Crimson.Yggdrasil.Api.Wcf.NetTcpProxyFactory<T> knows how to use these): ...
case.sTitle: Change SiteManager to write additional <appSettings> on deployment

event.s:
When SiteManager deploys a site it should add the following <appSetting> keys to the Web.config file:
Properties related to the location of the Yggdrasil service (Crimson.Yggdrasil.Api.Wcf.NetTcpProxyFactory<T> knows how to use these):
CrimsonYggdrasilHost
CrimsonYggdrasilNetTcpPort
CrimsonYggdrasilBasePah
CrimsonYggdrasilEnvironmentID (the ID of the environment the site is deployed in)
CrimsonYggdrasilMemberID (the ID of the Member for which the site is deployed, and only if a Member was assigned to the SiteDefinition)
event.sHtml:
When SiteManager deploys a site it should add the following <appSetting> keys to the Web.config file:

  • Properties related to the location of the Yggdrasil service (Crimson.Yggdrasil.Api.Wcf.NetTcpProxyFactory<T> knows how to use these):
    • CrimsonYggdrasilHost
    • CrimsonYggdrasilNetTcpPort
    • CrimsonYggdrasilBasePah
  • CrimsonYggdrasilEnvironmentID (the ID of the environment the site is deployed in)
  • CrimsonYggdrasilMemberID (the ID of the Member for which the site is deployed, and only if a Member was assigned to the SiteDefinition)

event.evtDescription: Assigned to Brock Bouchard by Brock Bouchard

case.sTitle: Introduce SiteDefinition and Member Association to SiteManager

event.s:
Case 52108 introduces an association between SiteDefinition and Member in the Yggdrasil model. We should change SiteManager to:
Provide a UI for associating a Member with a SiteDefinition
During deployment, if a member is assigned to a SiteDefinition:
Use integrated security in the connection string
Assign the application pool's identity to the account associated with the Member
event.sHtml:
Case 52108 introduces an association between SiteDefinition and Member in the Yggdrasil model.  We should change SiteManager to:

  • Provide a UI for associating a Member with a SiteDefinition
  • During deployment, if a member is assigned to a SiteDefinition:
    • Use integrated security in the connection string
    • Assign the application pool's identity to the account associated with the Member

event.evtDescription: Assigned to Brock Bouchard by Brock Bouchard

event.s:
Description -
1. Part 1 - Entity Framework's latest stable version 4.3.1 for .Net framework 4.0 has been added as a Nuget package. This can be seen from EF's folder under the Packages directory. EF is majorly powered by Nuget's Package Manager Console. Among the different types of db handling approaches available(Code First, Design First and Database First) we are using the Code First approach which is suitable for any project\product being started from scratch. This means that everything related related to db resides in the C# code - schema defining classes and corresponding configurations, linq queries and schema migration support too.
2. Part 2 - As a second part of this effort, the existing ado.net calls have been converted to EF calls and thus removing the SqlCommandWrapper.cs. Also, all native sql queries have been converted to linq to entities.
Features Added -
1. Code First Approach - All the schema is now defined as POCO in the Models folder. This schema was reverse engineered from the earlier available database and has been tested for equality using db\table comparison tools like SqlCompare by RedGate.
The relations between the different objects and other configurations are contained in the Configurations folder. This is has been done to follow the EF best practices recommended by authorities on the subject like Julie Lerman, etc. Configurations could also have been embedded in the POCO itself using the Attribute approach but it makes the code less readable and violates the separation of concerns principle. Therefore, the much richer Fluent API has been used to define configurations in a separate directory.
The PerformanceLabsDBContext class provides the db abstraction layer. It is configured to migrate the db to the latest migration(more on migrations later) by using CreateDatabaseIfNotExists and MigrateDatabaseToLatestVersion configurations in it's static constructor.
2. Migrations - To enable the Migrations feature provided by EF, we just need to type the 'Enable-Migrations' command on the Package Manager Console. This will add the Migrations folder and a Configuration.cs file in it. This fill will contain the general configurations for the Migrations feature and various events one can hook into to tweak the schema migration process.
Note that 'Enable-Migrations' is now not to be run for PerformanceLabs since it is only to be executed once in a lifetime of a project.
Note that since we have configured PerformanceLabs to migrate itself to latest migration and create database in case it is not present, the very first Migration will be empty. Why? The db will be created right at the moment EF comes into action using the Model defined. Thereafter, it will proceed to migrate the db to the latest migration available. Now if the InitialCreate(our very first migration) is not empty then EF will try to re-create the database and the migration will fail. This is why it is recommended that the very first Migration be empty in the Code First Approach that wants to automatically migrate it's db to the latest migration available.
How to add another migration? This is explained in the ReadMe.txt attached with this Case. This same file is also present in the Migrations folder in the code base.
event.sChanges: Tester changed from (None) to Brock Bouchard Code Reviewer changed from (None) to Brock Bouchard Title changed from 'Refactor - Introduce EF 4.x, DI in Performance Labs' to 'Refactor - Introduce EF 4.3.1 in Performance Labs'.
event.evtDescription: Assigned to Brock Bouchard by Kumar Vaibhav
event.sHtml:
Description -

1. Part 1 - Entity Framework's latest stable version 4.3.1 for .Net framework 4.0 has been added as a Nuget package. This can be seen from EF's folder under the Packages directory. EF is majorly powered by Nuget's Package Manager Console. Among the different types of db handling approaches available(Code First, Design First and Database First) we are using the Code First approach which is suitable for any project\product being started from scratch. This means that everything related related to db resides in the C# code - schema defining classes and corresponding configurations, linq queries and schema migration support too. 

2. Part 2 - As a second part of this effort, the existing ado.net calls have been converted to EF calls and thus removing the SqlCommandWrapper.cs. Also, all native sql queries have been converted to linq to entities. 

Features Added - 

1. Code First Approach - All the schema is now defined as POCO in the Models folder. This schema was reverse engineered from the earlier available database and has been tested for equality using db\table comparison tools like SqlCompare by RedGate.

The relations between the different objects and other configurations are contained in the Configurations folder. This is has been done to follow the EF best practices recommended by authorities on the subject like Julie Lerman, etc. Configurations could also have been embedded in the POCO itself using the Attribute approach but it makes the code less readable and violates the separation of concerns principle. Therefore, the much richer Fluent API has been used to define configurations in a separate directory. 

The PerformanceLabsDBContext class provides the db abstraction layer. It is configured to migrate the db to the latest migration(more on migrations later) by using CreateDatabaseIfNotExists and MigrateDatabaseToLatestVersion configurations in it's static constructor. 

2. Migrations - To enable the Migrations feature provided by EF, we just need to type the 'Enable-Migrations' command on the Package Manager Console. This will add the Migrations folder and a Configuration.cs file in it. This fill will contain the general configurations for the Migrations feature and various events one can hook into to tweak the schema migration process. 

Note that 'Enable-Migrations' is now not to be run for PerformanceLabs since it is only to be executed once in a lifetime of a project.

Note that since we have configured PerformanceLabs to migrate itself to latest migration and create database in case it is not present, the very first Migration will be empty. Why? The db will be created right at the moment EF comes into action using the Model defined. Thereafter, it will proceed to migrate the db to the latest migration available. Now if the InitialCreate(our very first migration) is not empty then EF will try to re-create the database and the migration will fail. This is why it is recommended that the very first Migration be empty in the Code First Approach that wants to automatically migrate it's db to the latest migration available. 

How to add another migration? This is explained in the ReadMe.txt attached with this Case. This same file is also present in the Migrations folder in the code base.

case.sLatestTextSummary: Summary Incorporate Curt's cross-domain network access code into the Crimson.Commons library. Details We have a need to do cross-domain file operations between our DEVID and CRIMSONAD domains, the primary use case being build artifact promotion ...
case.sTitle: Incorporate Curt's Cross-Domain network access code into Commons

event.s:
Summary
Incorporate Curt's cross-domain network access code into the Crimson.Commons library.
Details
We have a need to do cross-domain file operations between our DEVID and CRIMSONAD domains, the primary use case being build artifact promotion from development to staging in SiteManager. Unfortunately the impersonation code we have written (based on the Windows API function "LogonUser") does not work for cross-domain scenarios, and configuring domain trust proved too onerous.
When Curt first joined, he did some research into this and wrote a set of classes based on "net use" and the Windows API function WNetAddConnection2.
This ticket is to incorporate that code into the Commons code base.
Attached is Curt's original email delivering and outlining the solution.
event.sHtml:
Summary

Incorporate Curt's cross-domain network access code into the Crimson.Commons library.

Details

We have a need to do cross-domain file operations between our DEVID and CRIMSONAD domains, the primary use case being build artifact promotion from development to staging in SiteManager.  Unfortunately the impersonation code we have written (based on the Windows API function "LogonUser") does not work for cross-domain scenarios, and configuring domain trust proved too onerous.

When Curt first joined, he did some research into this and wrote a set of classes based on "net use" and the Windows API function WNetAddConnection2.

This ticket is to incorporate that code into the Commons code base.

Attached is Curt's original email delivering and outlining the solution.

case.sLatestTextSummary: Mandatory columns: Columns which are not identity, not null and have no default values are considered to be mandatory column. If there are no rules specified for these columns, data generator fails in pre-validation phase. In case of not nullable ...
case.sTitle: Support for default columns

event.evtDescription: Assigned to Brock Bouchard by Saurabh Agrawal

event.s:
Mandatory columns: Columns which are not identity, not null and have no default values are considered to be mandatory column. If there are no rules specified for these columns, data generator fails in pre-validation phase.
In case of not nullable columns which have default values specified in the schema and have no rules defined, datagenerator simply skips these columns and default values are inserted for these columns by sql server during bulk copy.
How it works:
We use SQLBulkCopy to insert data into the tables by constructing the datatable. Columns for which rules are not defined; we simply remove these columns from the datatable and provide a columnmapping for SQLBulkCopy command to map columns from source to destination.
event.sChanges: Developer changed from (None) to Saurabh Agrawal Tester changed from (None) to Kumar Vaibhav Code Reviewer changed from (None) to Brock Bouchard Status changed from 'New' to 'Assigned'.
event.evtDescription: Assigned to Saurabh Agrawal by Saurabh Agrawal
event.sHtml:
Mandatory columns: Columns which are not identity, not null and have no default values are considered to be mandatory column. If there are no rules specified for these columns, data generator fails in pre-validation phase.

In case of not nullable columns which have default values specified in the schema and have no rules defined, datagenerator simply skips these columns and default values are inserted for these columns by sql server during bulk copy.

How it works:

We use SQLBulkCopy to insert data into the tables by constructing the datatable. Columns for which rules are not defined; we simply remove these columns from the datatable and provide a columnmapping for SQLBulkCopy command to map columns from source to destination.

case.sTitle: SchemaUtil attempting to delete a schema that should be ignored

event.s:
SchemaUtil should only look at dbo and any schemas listed in SchemaUtilConfig.xml. If the schema is not in this list, it should be ignored and SchemaUtil should not try to delete any items from the schema or the schema itself.
This works fine for the cases where all schemas other than dbo are added to the SchemaUtilConfig.xml. This is the normal case as Engineering tends to use schemas and Services tends to add all items in the dbo schema. Now services is beginning to use additional schemas. In this case, the entire schema should be ignored. SchemaUtil was ignoring all items contained in the schema, but attempting to delete the schema itself. This caused SchemaUtil to throw an exception.
SchemaUtil should be updated to ignore not only the items in the schema, but the schema itself.
event.sHtml:
SchemaUtil should only look at dbo and any schemas listed in SchemaUtilConfig.xml.  If the schema is not in this list, it should be ignored and SchemaUtil should not try to delete any items from the schema or the schema itself.

This works fine for the cases where all schemas other than dbo are added to the SchemaUtilConfig.xml.  This is the normal case as Engineering tends to use schemas and Services tends to add all items in the dbo schema.  Now services is beginning to use additional schemas.  In this case, the entire schema should be ignored.  SchemaUtil was ignoring all items contained in the schema, but attempting to delete the schema itself.  This caused SchemaUtil to throw an exception.

SchemaUtil should be updated to ignore not only the items in the schema, but the schema itself.

case.sTitle: Implement command line arguments for input xml file and connection string

event.evtDescription: Assigned to Saurabh Agrawal by Saurabh Agrawal

event.s:
Goal
Accept XML file defining rules for data generation and target database details in command line for data generator tool. Idea is to make data generator tool independent and any external parameters has to be specified as command line arguments.
Sample Usage :
CrimsonDataGenerator.exe -f "D:DataGenerator.xml\" -s . -u testdev -p testdev"

case.sTitle: Code Refactoring : Create generetor instance using reflection instead of factory class

event.evtDescription: Assigned to Saurabh Agrawal by Saurabh Agrawal

event.s:
Goal
Create generator instance using reflection instead of factory class. Earlier we had a factory class to which we supplied the "generator string" and it used to return the generator instance.
Disadvantage of this approach is everytime we add a new generator we need to go and modify our factory class. Instantiating generators using reflection provides the flexibility of adding new generators without worrying about their instantiation.
event.sHtml:
Goal

Create generator instance using reflection instead of factory class. Earlier we had a factory class to which we supplied the "generator string" and it used to return the generator instance.

Disadvantage of this approach is everytime we add a new generator we need to go and modify our factory class. Instantiating generators using reflection provides the flexibility of adding new generators without worrying about their instantiation.

case.sTitle: Implement base directory concept for external data files

event.evtDescription: Assigned to Saurabh Agrawal by Saurabh Agrawal

event.s:
Goal :
Instead of specifying adddress of each external file seperately, we can have "BaseDirectory" tag in data generator, this will have list of comma seperated "Path" where external files can be present
Rule :
If "basedirectory" is not provided by the user, application's current execution path is taken by default.
In case of multiple paths specified in the "basedirectory", search for file existence stop s as soon as it finds file first time.

In case of multiple paths specified in the "basedirectory", search for file existence stop s as soon as it finds file first time.

case.sTitle: Implement support for external datasource

event.evtDescription: Assigned to Saurabh Agrawal by Saurabh Agrawal

event.s:
Goal
There are few columns for which data source is predefined and there is no need to generate data for these columns. One way was to embed all those values in xml file itself however it will make the xml file look complex.
We thought of providing support for external datasource wherein developer can list all possible values in a text file and provide the address of that text file as data source for that column.
e.g : Cohort Groups : Possible values are listed below
All hospitals
All Non-teaching hospitals
All Teaching hospitals
Large Hospitals - All|Large Teaching Hospitals
Mid-Sized Hospitals - All
Mid-Sized Non-Teaching Hospitals
Top Decile
Top Quartile
Residents
<Column Name="Name" Generator="StringGenerator" DataSource="DataSource\CohortGroups.txt" IsUnique="true"/>
event.sChanges: Developer changed from (None) to Saurabh Agrawal Tester changed from (None) to Rajesh Jagadeesan Code Reviewer changed from (None) to Brock Bouchard Status changed from 'New' to 'Assigned'.
event.sHtml:
Goal

There are few columns for which data source is predefined and there is no need to generate data for these columns. One way was to embed all those values in xml file itself however it will make the xml file look complex.

We thought of providing support for external datasource wherein developer can list all possible values in a text file and provide the address of that text file as data source for that column.

e.g : Cohort Groups : Possible values are listed below 

 

All hospitals
All Non-teaching hospitals
All Teaching hospitals
Large Hospitals - All|Large Teaching Hospitals
Mid-Sized Hospitals - All
Mid-Sized Non-Teaching Hospitals
Top Decile
Top Quartile
Residents
 
<Column Name="Name" Generator="StringGenerator" DataSource="DataSource\CohortGroups.txt" IsUnique="true"/>

case.sTitle: Create BaseBuildConfiguration Project with PlatformBuildConfiguration as first consumer

event.s:
Overview
We current have, or are about to have, several NuGet packages originating from various repositories in Kiln, many of which are needed as part of the platform initiative:
CCC Web Services Proxy Lib
Yggdrasil Web Services Proxy Lib (formerly "SiteManager API")
Crimson.ServiceLayerLib
Crimson.Utility
DataGenerator
Onus
We need to create a shared build server and standardize a source tree contract for running builds, tests and publishing to Nuget (the latter is currently a manual process)
event.sHtml:
Overview

We current have, or are about to have, several NuGet packages originating from various repositories in Kiln, many of which are needed as part of the platform initiative:

  • CCC Web Services Proxy Lib
  • Yggdrasil Web Services Proxy Lib (formerly "SiteManager API")
  • Crimson.ServiceLayerLib
  • Crimson.Utility
  • DataGenerator
  • Onus

We need to create a shared build server and standardize a source tree contract for running builds, tests and publishing to Nuget (the latter is currently a manual process)

case.sLatestTextSummary: When an exception occurs in SchemaUtil, the error messages should be written to Console.Error to allow capturing of the error messages. Also, an error code should be returned to the environment to indicate success or failure. 0 should be returned ...
case.sTitle: SchemaUtil not returning error code on exception

event.s:
When an exception occurs in SchemaUtil, the error messages should be written to Console.Error to allow capturing of the error messages. Also, an error code should be returned to the environment to indicate success or failure. 0 should be returned on success and -1 on failure.
Currently some exceptions return a status code, and all others return 0. THe return code is inconsistent. Also, error messages are written to StdOut and not StdErr.
event.sHtml:
When an exception occurs in SchemaUtil, the error messages should be written to Console.Error to allow capturing of the error messages.  Also, an error code should be returned to the environment to indicate success or failure.  0 should be returned on success and -1 on failure.

Currently some exceptions return a status code, and all others return 0.  THe return code is inconsistent.  Also, error messages are written to StdOut and not StdErr.

case.sLatestTextSummary: I have found that having to manually remember to update build/patch number prior to deploying a nuget package is proving cumbersome. We thus need a solution that increments build/patch number so long as major/minor version does not change. If ...
case.sTitle: Add auto build numbers per major/minor version, create setup application

event.s:
I have found that having to manually remember to update build/patch number prior to deploying a nuget package is proving cumbersome. We thus need a solution that increments build/patch number so long as major/minor version does not change. If major/minor version do change, the build/patch number should reset to 0.
Unfortunately there is no easy way to do this with CC.net out of the box, so we've had to create a plugin. This is easy enough, but adds to the complexity of setting up the build server. I have thus added a setup program, called via a batch file. Altogether these things will:
configure ccnet config files
configure the ccnet service (set to automatic start and assign DEVID\Build)
schedule a task to run a clean up script (that by default nukes nunit shadow copy cache for the build user)
event.sHtml:
I have found that having to manually remember to update build/patch number prior to deploying a nuget package is proving cumbersome.  We thus need a solution that increments build/patch number so long as major/minor version does not change.  If major/minor version do change, the build/patch number should reset to 0.

Unfortunately there is no easy way to do this with CC.net out of the box, so we've had to create a plugin.  This is easy enough, but adds to the complexity of setting up the build server.  I have thus added a setup program, called via a batch file.  Altogether these things will:

  • configure ccnet config files
  • configure the ccnet service (set to automatic start and assign DEVID\Build)
  • schedule a task to run a clean up script (that by default nukes nunit shadow copy cache for the build user)

case.sTitle: Refinements to BaseBuildConfiguration and PlatformBuildConfiguration repositories

event.s:
Goal
This ticket incorporates refinements to the project started 46294, which started out as an effort to build a shared platform build server.
Details
We now have 2 repositories:
BaseBuildConfiguration - this servers as a bare-bones CC.net configuration that can be used to setup a build server. The idea is that new build servers would have their own repositories (e.g. PlatformBuildConfiguration or CCCBuildConfiguration), which would be seeded with the content of BaseBuildConfiguration, and customized as necessary. Updates to the shared configuration will be delivered simply by pulling from BaseBuildConfiguration, while customizations would stay in the child repository and never be pushed back.
PlatformBuildConfiguration - this is the first child repository of BaseBuildConfiguration that is being used to run a build server for Core and Shared Platform projects.
event.sHtml:
Goal

This ticket incorporates refinements to the project started 46294, which started out as an effort to build a shared platform build server.

Details

We now have 2 repositories:

BaseBuildConfiguration - this servers as a bare-bones CC.net configuration that can be used to setup a build server.  The idea is that new build servers would have their own repositories (e.g. PlatformBuildConfiguration or CCCBuildConfiguration), which would be seeded with the content of BaseBuildConfiguration, and customized as necessary.  Updates to the shared configuration will be delivered simply by pulling from BaseBuildConfiguration, while customizations would stay in the child repository and never be pushed back.

PlatformBuildConfiguration - this is the first child repository of BaseBuildConfiguration that is being used to run a build server for Core and Shared Platform projects.

event.evtDescription: Assigned to Brock Bouchard by Brock Bouchard

event.sChanges: Status changed from 'Assigned' to 'Resolved (Needs Review)'.
event.evtDescription: Resolved (Needs Review) and assigned to Brock Bouchard by Saurabh Agrawal
event.sHtml:
Hi Brock,
 
There is no code to check in. Copying the xml which will be used to generate the data.

<Table Name="temp_CPOEOrders" Count="1000">
      <ForeignKey Name="EncounterNumber"  ParentColumn="Encounter" ParentTable="temp_discharge"/>
      <Derived Name="OrderEnteredDate" Method="GetDateBetweenColumns" Parameter1="'admission_date'" Parameter2="'discharge_date'" Parameter3="'temp_discharge'" Parameter4="'Encounter'" Parameter5="EncounterNumber"/>
      <Derived Name="Description" Method="Concat" Parameter1="EncounterNumber" Parameter2="'_Desc'"></Derived>
      <Constant Name="Frequency" Value="''"></Constant>
      <Rand_Real Name="Amount" MinValue="0" MaxValue="1000"></Rand_Real>
      <ForeignKey Name="OrderingPhysicianID"  ParentColumn="physicianid" ParentTable="temp_physician" Seed="1" WhereCondition="temp_physician.IsResident=1"/>
      <ForeignKey Name="AttendingPhysicianID"  ParentColumn="physicianid" ParentTable="temp_physician" IsNullable="true" NullThreshold="0.1" Seed="1"></ForeignKey>
</Table>

Thanks,
Saurabh

case.sLatestTextSummary: SiteManager/Yggdrasil previously had a concept called "Environment" that modeled the pairing of an application web and database server, and a concept called "SiteManagerInstance" that modeled things like Development vs Staging vs Production. These ...
case.sTitle: Rename Environment->ServerLink and SiteManagerInstance->Environment

event.s:
SiteManager/Yggdrasil previously had a concept called "Environment" that modeled the pairing of an application web and database server, and a concept called "SiteManagerInstance" that modeled things like Development vs Staging vs Production. These names were not really working well, as most folks would call the latter an "Environment".
This ticket thus renames Environments->ServerPairs, and SiteManagerInstances->Environments.
event.sHtml:
SiteManager/Yggdrasil previously had a concept called "Environment" that modeled the pairing of an application web and database server, and a concept called "SiteManagerInstance" that modeled things like Development vs Staging vs Production.  These names were not really working well, as most folks would call the latter an "Environment".

This ticket thus renames Environments->ServerPairs, and SiteManagerInstances->Environments.

case.sTitle: Fix up validation to work across SiteManager-Yggdrasil service boundary

event.s:
This ticket represents work to ensure an application consuming Yggdrasil can validate Yggdrasil entities being modified. Summary of changes:
- Introduced ValidationResultDto and ValidationMessageDto to the Yggdrasil API
- Had to change Yggdrasil core validation model to eschew generics (which facilitated auto mapping)
- Created a set of constants in Yggdrasil API defining validation property names
event.sHtml:
This ticket represents work to ensure an application consuming Yggdrasil can validate Yggdrasil entities being modified.  Summary of changes:

- Introduced ValidationResultDto and ValidationMessageDto to the Yggdrasil API

- Had to change Yggdrasil core validation model to eschew generics (which facilitated auto mapping)

- Created a set of constants in Yggdrasil API defining validation property names

case.sLatestTextSummary: The work done in this ticket represents improvements to error reporting in SiteManager and Yggdrasil. I'll let the code commit comments speak to the technical details, but the summary of changes is as follows: - Introduced ELMAH and custom error ...
case.sTitle: Improve error reporting

event.s:
The work done in this ticket represents improvements to error reporting in SiteManager and Yggdrasil. I'll let the code commit comments speak to the technical details, but the summary of changes is as follows:
- Introduced ELMAH and custom error pages into SiteManager web application
- Added web service header and "action filter" support to ServiceLayerLib
- Changed Yggdrasil web services to use an "action filter" that requires calling applicaiton and user name in headers; also changed Yggdrasil error storage to include calling application and user name
- Added Yggdrasil Errors screen in SiteManager web application
event.sHtml:
The work done in this ticket represents improvements to error reporting in SiteManager and Yggdrasil.  I'll let the code commit comments speak to the technical details, but the summary of changes is as follows:

- Introduced ELMAH and custom error pages into SiteManager web application

- Added web service header and "action filter" support to ServiceLayerLib

- Changed Yggdrasil web services to use an "action filter" that requires calling applicaiton and user name in headers; also changed Yggdrasil error storage to include calling application and user name

- Added Yggdrasil Errors screen in SiteManager web application
