case.sTitle: Set IIS permissions for App_Data and _ApplicationLogs as part of site deployment

event.s:
(This ticket comes to us from Services team as request to help them automate the implementation process)
Our Services team is having to manually set IIS permissions on
App_Data
_ApplicationLogs
EVERY time they deploy/redeploy a site. This is tedious and annoying for them and is obviously error prone as it's easy to forget to do. Let's automate this!
Researching about MSDeploy it looks like it's possible to create an xml config file which sets ACL permissions on application folders as part of the deployment process. SiteManager uses msdeploy to actually deploy an artifact as an application in IIS. So, we just need to tell MSDeploy to set the correct folder permissions whenever it deploys a site.
Background
Our cache relies on App_Data/WSCache to store it's cache entries. This folder must always be readable/writable by IIS_USER.
Elmah writes to _ApplicationLogs. This must also be readable/writable by IIS_USER.
Notes
http://technet.microsoft.com/en-us/library/dd569047(WS.10).aspx
http://robertbigec.wordpress.com/2012/02/24/setting-custom-folder-permissions-during-web-deployment/
http://forums.asp.net/t/1697424.aspx/1
(I estimate this takes about 6 hours of work)
event.sHtml:
(This ticket comes to us from Services team as request to help them automate the implementation process)

 

Our Services team is having to manually set IIS permissions on

  • App_Data
  • _ApplicationLogs

EVERY time they deploy/redeploy a site. This is tedious and annoying for them and is obviously error prone as it's easy to forget to do. Let's automate this!

Researching about MSDeploy it looks like it's possible to create an xml config file which sets ACL permissions on application folders as part of the deployment process. SiteManager uses msdeploy to actually deploy an artifact as an application in IIS. So, we just need to tell MSDeploy to set the correct folder permissions whenever it deploys a site.

Background

Our cache relies on App_Data/WSCache to store it's cache entries. This folder must always be readable/writable by IIS_USER.

Elmah writes to _ApplicationLogs. This must also be readable/writable by IIS_USER.

Notes

http://technet.microsoft.com/en-us/library/dd569047(WS.10).aspx

http://robertbigec.wordpress.com/2012/02/24/setting-custom-folder-permissions-during-web-deployment/

http://forums.asp.net/t/1697424.aspx/1

(I estimate this takes about 6 hours of work)

event.s:
Hi Alex,
As I'm new to the team, I wanted to understand the various steps involved the automated build process.
I went through the steps in the cpm build file specified for NAnt[in the MainFrame code] and also tried out the build locally.As I understand it, the output of the build would be a package [a zipped version of the compiled web project], along with the executable for the dataloader and stuff related to database migration.
I am assuming that the automated build tool would run NAnt and to create the artefacts which would then be deployed in IIS [using site manager]. I'd like to know how the virtual directories are created for each of our clients/qa teams after the artefacts are obtained from the NAnt build.
I ask this because we can use msdeploy to set permissions for folders when we create the virtual directories. I could not find a way in which we can specify acl during package creation itself.
Please do let me know if my understanding is correct.
Regards,
Balaji
event.sChanges: Status changed from 'Assigned' to 'Info Needed'.
event.evtDescription: Assigned to Alex Spinnler by Sri Gopinath
event.sHtml:
Hi Alex,

As I'm new to the team, I wanted to understand the various steps involved the automated build process.

I went through the steps in the cpm build file specified for NAnt[in the MainFrame code] and also tried out the build locally.As I understand it, the output of the build would be a package [a zipped version of the compiled web project], along with the executable for the dataloader and stuff related to database migration.

I am assuming that the automated build tool would run NAnt and to create the artefacts which would then be deployed in IIS [using site manager]. I'd like to know how the virtual directories are created for each of our clients/qa teams after the artefacts are obtained from the NAnt build.

I ask this because we can use msdeploy to set permissions for folders when we create the virtual directories. I could not find a way in which we can specify acl during package creation itself.

Please do let me know if my understanding is correct.

 

Regards,

Balaji

event.s:
Balaji-
Nant creates the zip artifact which SiteManager then deploys to IIS using msdeploy under the covers.
I've asked Arun to help in answering any other questions so that we're not hindered by the time delay between us.
Alex

event.s:
I've been doing some research and here is what I found about MSDeploy's setAcl command fromMicrosoft's tech notes:
The setAcl provider accepts the following argument settings.
A site path (for example, "Default Web Site" or MySite)
An application path (for example, "Default Web Site/MyApp"or MySite/MyApp/default.htm)
A directory path (for example, c:\mydirectory)
A file path (for example, c:\mydirectory\test.htm)
Relative paths like ./mypath or . are not accepted.
Since our destination is a package, we cannot add any of these arguments.
event.sHtml:
I've been doing some research and here is what I found about MSDeploy's setAcl command fromMicrosoft's tech notes:

The setAcl provider accepts the following argument settings.

  • A site path (for example, "Default Web Site" or MySite)
     
  • An application path (for example, "Default Web Site/MyApp"or MySite/MyApp/default.htm)
     
  • A directory path (for example, c:\mydirectory)
     
  • A file path (for example, c:\mydirectory\test.htm)

Relative paths like ./mypath or . are not accepted.

Since our destination is a package, we cannot add any of these arguments.

event.s:
Sri-
Thanks for your work on this. iisPatch2 looks good. One last note:
In GetDestinationAclProviders() I would instantiate the list as size 2 since you already know that you're going to add to the list. Otherwise, the list will have its default capacity of 0. Then, the next line when .Add() is called its internal structure that is used for storage will have to be reallocated.
Once you have SiteManager permissions please create the branch apply your code and resolve back to me. At that time, we can pull in Brock Bouchard so that he can approve the code.

case.sTitle: Revamp Site Manager Architecture

event.s:
The architecture of SiteManager needs a revamp. Basically we need to split SiteManager into two components: a "platform" of web services and a thin web application calling these web services.
Here was ultimately ended up getting built:
Crimson Yggdrasil - this is the name I chose for the SiteManager web service API. It's purpose is to be the API powering future automation tools and cross product communication. The name comes from old Norse mythology; Yggdrasil is the giant ash tree connecting the 9 worlds. I needed some kind of symbolic name that didn't have connotations. Other proposed names ("SiteManager", "Platform", "Hub", "Bus") all have strong connotations that may or may not ultimately be true.
Stripped-down SiteManager.Web project. I removed most of the UI, except for the about page, which I used as a driver to setup successful consumption of the information web service. The next step is to re-introduce each part of the SiteManager user interface by building out and consuming Yggdrasil.
ServiceLayerLib and code generator - a library for creating WCF-specific code from a technology agnostic service layer.
event.sHtml:
The architecture of SiteManager needs a revamp.  Basically we need to split SiteManager into two components: a "platform" of web services and a thin web application calling these web services.

Here was ultimately ended up getting built:

  • Crimson Yggdrasil - this is the name I chose for the SiteManager web service API.  It's purpose is to be the API powering future automation tools and cross product communication.  The name comes from old Norse mythology; Yggdrasil is the giant ash tree connecting the 9 worlds.  I needed some kind of symbolic name that didn't have connotations.  Other proposed names ("SiteManager", "Platform", "Hub", "Bus") all have strong connotations that may or may not ultimately be true.
  • Stripped-down SiteManager.Web project.  I removed most of the UI, except for the about page, which I used as a driver to setup successful consumption of the information web service.  The next step is to re-introduce each part of the SiteManager user interface by building out and consuming Yggdrasil.
  • ServiceLayerLib and code generator - a library for creating WCF-specific code from a technology agnostic service layer.

case.sLatestTextSummary: Moving SiteManager tickets into Shared Platform project
case.sTitle: Add support To SiteManager to control Application Pool timeout

event.s:
Starting with the 02 release, CCC needs the ability to control Application Pool timeout settings. We will achieve this by adding two nullable columns to the Products table:
AppPoolProcessIdleTimeout AppPoolRecycleRegularTimeInterval
If either of these values is set, it will be applied to the corresponding application pool setting at deployment time. The CCC team needs to set these values to 0 to support our new OnDemand feature which relies heavily on caching.
However, there is an interesting temporary wrinkle. We really don't have the necessary RAM on our web servers to support setting the timeout to 0. We thus are receiving a new server with lots of RAM on which we will deploy the release. However, if we make the setting of the timeout entirely product specific, our existing web server will have the timeout set to 0 as well. Unfotunately our current web server cannot handle this as we do not have enough RAM.
We are thus introducing a temporary hack to the indicate that a server is the target server for the OnDemand beta feature. The business analysts will manually set the Servers.IsOnDemandBeta column to 1. If this value is present, we'll set the timeout.
Once all of the CCC servers are ready never to recycle, we'll remove this hack.
event.sHtml:
Starting with the 02 release, CCC needs the ability to control Application Pool timeout settings.  We will achieve this by adding two nullable columns to the Products table:

AppPoolProcessIdleTimeout
AppPoolRecycleRegularTimeInterval 

If either of these values is set, it will be applied to the corresponding application pool setting at deployment time.  The CCC team needs to set these values to 0 to support our new OnDemand feature which relies heavily on caching.

However, there is an interesting temporary wrinkle.  We really don't have the necessary RAM on our web servers to support setting the timeout to 0.  We thus are receiving a new server with lots of RAM on which we will deploy the release.  However, if we make the setting of the timeout entirely product specific, our existing web server will have the timeout set to 0 as well.  Unfotunately our current web server cannot handle this as we do not have enough RAM.

We are thus introducing a temporary hack to the indicate that a server is the target server for the OnDemand beta feature.  The business analysts will manually set the Servers.IsOnDemandBeta column to 1.  If this value is present, we'll set the timeout.

Once all of the CCC servers are ready never to recycle, we'll remove this hack.

case.sLatestTextSummary: In creating the Crimson.Commons library, we pulled code related to command line parsing and impersonation that existed in various projects. Unfortunately, the code did not have tests. We should thus write tests for for types in the ...
case.sTitle: Unit tests for types in Crimson.Commons.CommandLine and Crimson.Commons.Impersonation namespaces

event.s:
In creating the Crimson.Commons library, we pulled code related to command line parsing and impersonation that existed in various projects. Unfortunately, the code did not have tests.
We should thus write tests for for types in the Crimson.Commons.CommandLine and Crimson.Commons.Impersonation namespaces.
This would be a good opportunity for someone looking to improve their unit test skills.
event.sHtml:
In creating the Crimson.Commons library, we pulled code related to command line parsing and impersonation that existed in various projects.  Unfortunately, the code did not have tests.

We should thus write tests for for types in the Crimson.Commons.CommandLine and Crimson.Commons.Impersonation namespaces.

This would be a good opportunity for someone looking to improve their unit test skills.

event.evtDescription: Assigned to Brock Bouchard by Brock Bouchard

case.sTitle: Create Commons solution with existing Enumerations code

event.s: The new Commons repository has been created within Kiln. The first component added to the Commons project will be the Enumeration code from CPM.Common. A new solution needs to be created for Commons that includes the existing Enumeration code and unit tests. This should be packaged as a nuget package.

case.sLatestTextSummary: There are a couple of "Crimson.Utility" efforts floating around out there whose intent was similar to that of Crimson.Commons: - Crimson.Utility in the SiteManager code base. - Crimson.Utility in CI "Thunderbolt" code base. We should merge those ...
case.sTitle: Umbrella: Merge various Crimson.Utility efforts into Crimson.Commons

event.s:
There are a couple of "Crimson.Utility" efforts floating around out there whose intent was similar to that of Crimson.Commons:
- Crimson.Utility in the SiteManager code base. - Crimson.Utility in CI "Thunderbolt" code base.
We should merge those into Crimson.Commons.
We also should setup a continuous integration and publishing mechanism similar to the other Shared Platform efforts.
event.sHtml:
There are a couple of "Crimson.Utility" efforts floating around out there whose intent was similar to that of Crimson.Commons:

- Crimson.Utility in the SiteManager code base.
- Crimson.Utility in CI "Thunderbolt" code base.

We should merge those into Crimson.Commons.

We also should setup a continuous integration and publishing mechanism similar to the other Shared Platform efforts.

event.evtDescription: Assigned to Brock Bouchard by Brock Bouchard

event.s: Hi Brock,   There is no code to check in. Copying the xml which will be used to generate the data.         PhysicianID,Hospital,Specialty1,Specialty2,Specialty3,Specialty4
event.sChanges: Status changed from 'Assigned' to 'Resolved (Needs Review)'.
event.evtDescription: Resolved (Needs Review) and assigned to Brock Bouchard by Saurabh Agrawal
event.sHtml:
Hi Brock,
 
There is no code to check in. Copying the xml which will be used to generate the data.
 
<Table Name="temp_physician" Count="50">
      <UniqueConstraint>PhysicianID,Hospital,Specialty1,Specialty2,Specialty3,Specialty4</UniqueConstraint>
      <Rand_Int Name="PhysicianID" MinValue="1" MaxValue="10"/>
      <Derived Name="PhysicianName"  Method="Concat" Parameter1="'PhyscianLast,PhysicianFirst'" Parameter2="PhysicianID"></Derived>
      <External Name="Status" DataSource="PhysicianStatus.txt"></External>
      <ForeignKey Name="Specialty1" ParentColumn="SpecialtyName" ParentTable="temp_specialties" Seed="100"></ForeignKey>
      <ForeignKey Name="Specialty2" ParentColumn="SpecialtyName" ParentTable="temp_specialties" IsNullable="true" Seed="200" NullThreshold="0.5"></ForeignKey>
      <ForeignKey Name="Specialty3" ParentColumn="SpecialtyName" ParentTable="temp_specialties" IsNullable="true" Seed="300" NullThreshold="0.7"></ForeignKey>
      <ForeignKey Name="Specialty4" ParentColumn="SpecialtyName" ParentTable="temp_specialties" IsNullable="true" Seed="400" NullThreshold="0.9"></ForeignKey>
      <Derived Name="IsActive" Method="GetReferenceStringFromExternalFile" Parameter1="'1'" Parameter2="'PhysicianStatus.txt'" Parameter3="'0'" Parameter4="Status" Parameter5="'false'"></Derived>
      <ForeignKey Name="Hospital" ParentColumn="HospitalName" ParentTable="temp_hospital" ></ForeignKey>
      <Rand_Bool Name="IsResident"></Rand_Bool>
      <Derived Name="Entity"  Method="GetReferenceString" Parameter1="'Entity_Code'" Parameter2="'temp_hospital'" Parameter3="'HospitalName'" Parameter4="Hospital"></Derived>
      <Derived Name="Pavilion"  Method="GetReferenceString" Parameter1="'Pavilion_Code'" Parameter2="'temp_hospital'" Parameter3="'HospitalName'" Parameter4="Hospital"></Derived>
      <Derived Name="NPI"  Method="Concat" Parameter1="'NPI'" Parameter2="PhysicianID"></Derived>
    </Table>

There is no code to check in. Copying the xml which will be used to generate the data.
 
<Table Name="Temp_PatientTypes">
      <Columns>PatientTypeName,PatientTypeDescription</Columns>
      <Row>EM,Emergency</Row>
      <Row>OUT,OutPatient</Row>
      <Row>INP,Inpatient</Row>
      <Row>OBS,Observation</Row>
    </Table>

event.s: These cases dont need any review as there is no code associated with them. These case were created as part of initial strategy to use red gate sql data generator tool for data generation.

case.sTitle: Data generation for "temp_outpatientdischarge" csv file

event.evtDescription: Assigned to Saurabh Agrawal by Saurabh Agrawal

event.sChanges: Developer changed from (None) to Saurabh Agrawal Tester changed from (None) to Rajesh Jagadeesan Code Reviewer changed from (None) to Brock Bouchard Status changed from 'New' to 'Assigned'. Milestone changed from 'Undecided' to 'Release CCC.2012.05: 6/30/2012'.

event.s:
Moving to enhancement backlog as we are building our own data generation tool. Both benerator and Red Gate SQL DataGenerator tool didnt satisfy all our requirements.
Red Gate tool is licensed one and there was need to procure license for entire crimson dev team which is not feasible at the moment.
event.sChanges: Milestone changed from 'Release CCC.2012.05: 6/30/2012' to 'Enhancements Backlog'.
event.sHtml:
Moving to enhancement backlog as we are building our own data generation tool. Both benerator and Red Gate SQL DataGenerator tool didnt satisfy all our requirements.

Red Gate tool is licensed one and there was need to procure license for entire crimson dev team which is not feasible at the moment.

event.s:
Hi Brock,
There is no code to check in. Copying the xml which will be used to generate the data.
<Table Name="temp_outpatientdischarge" Count="1000">
<Seq_Int Name="Encounter" Increment="1" MinValue="1000001"/>
<Seq_Int Name="medical_record_number" Increment="1" MinValue="2000001"/>
<ForeignKey Name="Hospital" ParentColumn="HospitalName" ParentTable="temp_hospital"></ForeignKey>
<Derived Name="Entity" Method="GetReferenceString" Parameter1="'Entity_Code'" Parameter2="'temp_hospital'" Parameter3="'HospitalName'" Parameter4="Hospital"></Derived>
<Derived Name="Pavilion" Method="GetReferenceString" Parameter1="'Pavilion_Code'" Parameter2="'temp_hospital'" Parameter3="'HospitalName'" Parameter4="Hospital"></Derived>
<Derived Name="SubscriberID" Method="GetValue" Parameter1="medical_record_number"></Derived>
<Derived Name="patient_name" Method="Concat" Parameter1="'PatientLast,PatientFirst_'" Parameter2="medical_record_number"></Derived>
<Rand_Date Name="patient_dob" MinValue="1941-01-01" MaxValue="2007-12-31"/>
<String Name="sex" Value="M|F"/>
<Constant Name="RACETITLE" Value="\\"/>
<Derived Name="admission_date" Method="AddRandomDaysAndTimeToDate" Parameter1="'2007-12-31'" Parameter2="'1000'" Parameter3="'24'"/>
<Derived Name="discharge_date" Method="AddRandomHoursToDate" Parameter1="admission_date" Parameter2="'24'"/>
<Derived Name="admission_time" Method="GetValue" Parameter1="admission_date"/>
<Derived Name="discharge_time" Method="GetValue" Parameter1="discharge_date"/>

event.sHtml:
Hi Brock,
 
There is no code to check in. Copying the xml which will be used to generate the data.
 
<Table Name="temp_outpatientdischarge" Count="1000">
      <Seq_Int Name="Encounter" Increment="1" MinValue="1000001"/>
      <Seq_Int Name="medical_record_number" Increment="1" MinValue="2000001"/>
      <ForeignKey Name="Hospital"  ParentColumn="HospitalName" ParentTable="temp_hospital"></ForeignKey>
      <Derived Name="Entity"  Method="GetReferenceString" Parameter1="'Entity_Code'" Parameter2="'temp_hospital'" Parameter3="'HospitalName'" Parameter4="Hospital"></Derived>
      <Derived Name="Pavilion"  Method="GetReferenceString" Parameter1="'Pavilion_Code'" Parameter2="'temp_hospital'" Parameter3="'HospitalName'" Parameter4="Hospital"></Derived>
      <Derived Name="SubscriberID"  Method="GetValue" Parameter1="medical_record_number"></Derived>

      <String Name="sex" Value="M|F"/>

      <Derived Name="admission_time" Method="GetValue" Parameter1="admission_date"/>
      <Derived Name="discharge_time" Method="GetValue" Parameter1="discharge_date"/>

event.s:
Moving to enhancement backlog as we are building our own data generation tool. Both benerator and Red Gate SQL DataGenerator tool didnt satisfy all our requirements.
Red Gate tool is licensed one and there was need to procure license for entire crimson dev team which is not feasible at the moment.

There is no code to check in. Copying the xml which will be used to generate the data.

event.sHtml:
Hi Brock,
 
There is no code to check in. Copying the xml which will be used to generate the data.
 
<Table Name="temp_OutpatientCdmCharges" Count="10000">
      <ForeignKey Name="CDM"  ParentColumn="CDM" ParentTable="temp_cdmmaster"/>
      <Rand_Int Name="Quantity" MinValue="1" MaxValue="10"/>
      <Rand_Real Name="TotalCharge" MaxValue="110.5" MinValue="0.5" />
      <ForeignKey Name="EncounterNumber"  ParentColumn="encounter" ParentTable="temp_outpatientdischarge"/>
      <Derived Name="ServiceDate" Method="GetDateBetweenColumns" Parameter1="'admission_date'" Parameter2="'discharge_date'" Parameter3="'temp_outpatientdischarge'" Parameter4="'encounter'" Parameter5="EncounterNumber"/>
      <Rand_Real Name="TotalCost" MaxValue="110.5" MinValue="0.5" Seed="1"/>
      <ForeignKey Name="Physician"  ParentColumn="physicianid" ParentTable="temp_physician" IsNullable="true" NullThreshold="0.25" />
      <External Name="CPTHCPCS" DataSource="CPTCodes.txt" IsNullable="true" NullThreshold="0.50" Ordinal="0" SkipHeader="true" Seed="50"/>
      <External Name="ECG" DataSource="ECGs.txt" IsNullable="true" NullThreshold="0.5" Ordinal="0" SkipHeader="true" Seed="100"/>
    </Table>

event.s:
Moving to enhancement backlog as we are building our own data generation tool. Both benerator and Red Gate SQL DataGenerator tool didnt satisfy all our requirements.
Red Gate tool is licensed one and there was need to procure license for entire crimson dev team which is not feasible at the moment.

event.s: Hi Brock,   There is no code to check in. Copying the xml which will be used to generate the data.
event.sChanges: Status changed from 'Assigned' to 'Resolved (Needs Review)'.
event.evtDescription: Resolved (Needs Review) and assigned to Brock Bouchard by Saurabh Agrawal
event.sHtml:
Hi Brock,
 
There is no code to check in. Copying the xml which will be used to generate the data.
 
<Table Name="Temp_OppeReport" Count="200">
      <ForeignKey Name="PhysicianID"  ParentColumn="physicianid" ParentTable="temp_physician"/>
      <ForeignKey Name="MeasureName"  ParentColumn="OPPEMeasureName" ParentTable="Temp_OppeMeasureConfig" WhereCondition="Temp_OppeMeasureConfig.IsFinalResult='no'"/>
      <Rand_Date Name="StartDate"  MinValue="2007-12-31" MaxValue="2012-06-30"/>
      <Derived Name ="EndDate" Method="GetDateBetween" Parameter1="StartDate" Parameter2="'2012-06-30'" IsNullable="true" NullThreshold="0.5"/>
      <Constant Name="IncidentDescription"  Value="Incident Description"/>
      <ForeignKey Name="EncounterNumber"  ParentColumn="encounter" ParentTable="temp_discharge"/>
      <Derived Name="Hospital"  Method="GetReferenceString" Parameter1="'Hospital'" Parameter2="'temp_discharge'" Parameter3="'Encounter'" Parameter4="EncounterNumber"></Derived>
      <Derived Name ="Result" Method="GetOppeResult" Parameter1="MeasureName"/>
    </Table>

event.s: These cases dont need any review as there is no code associated with them. These case were created as part of initial strategy to use red gate sql data generator tool for data generation.

event.sHtml:
Hi Brock,
 
There is no code to check in. Copying the xml which will be used to generate the data.
 
<Table Name="temp_opperatereport" Count="200">
      <ForeignKey Name="PhysicianID"  ParentColumn="physicianid" ParentTable="temp_physician"/>
      <ForeignKey Name="MeasureName"  ParentColumn="OPPEMeasureName" ParentTable="Temp_OppeMeasureConfig" WhereCondition="Temp_OppeMeasureConfig.IsFinalResult='yes'"/>
      <Rand_Date Name="StartDate" MinValue="2007-12-31" MaxValue="2012-06-30"/>
      <Derived Name ="EndDate" Method="GetDateBetween" Parameter1="StartDate" Parameter2="'2012-06-30'" IsNullable="true" NullThreshold="0.5"/>
      <Constant Name="IncidentDescription"  Value="Incident Description"/>
      <Rand_Real Name="Numerator" MinValue="1" MaxValue="20"/>
      <Derived Name="Denominator" Method="GetDoubleBetween" Parameter1="Numerator" Parameter2="'20'"/>
      <ForeignKey Name="EncounterNumber"  ParentColumn="encounter" ParentTable="temp_discharge"/>
      <Derived Name="Hospital"  Method="GetReferenceString" Parameter1="'Hospital'" Parameter2="'temp_discharge'" Parameter3="'Encounter'" Parameter4="EncounterNumber"></Derived>
 
    </Table>

event.s:
Hi Brock,
There is no code to check in. Copying the xml which will be used to generate the data.
<Table Name="temp_discharge" Count="1000">
<Seq_Int Name="Encounter" Increment="1" MinValue="200"/>
<Rand_Int Name="Patient" MinValue="1" MaxValue="10000" IsUnique ="true" ></Rand_Int>
<Seq_Int Name="medical_record_number" Increment="1" MinValue="2000001"/>
<ForeignKey Name="Hospital" ParentColumn="HospitalName" ParentTable="temp_hospital"></ForeignKey>
<Derived Name="Entity" Method="GetReferenceString" Parameter1="'Entity_Code'" Parameter2="'temp_hospital'" Parameter3="'HospitalName'" Parameter4="Hospital"></Derived>
<Derived Name="Pavilion" Method="GetReferenceString" Parameter1="'Pavilion_Code'" Parameter2="'temp_hospital'" Parameter3="'HospitalName'" Parameter4="Hospital"></Derived>
<Derived Name="SubscriberID" Method="GetValue" Parameter1="Patient"></Derived>
<Derived Name="patient_name" Method="Concat" Parameter1="'PatientLast,PatientFirst_'" Parameter2="Patient"></Derived>
<Seq_Date Name="patient_dob" MinValue="1941-01-01" Increment="1"/>
<External DataSource="DischargeDisposition.txt" Name="DischargeDisposition"/>
<ForeignKey Name="discharge_physician" ParentColumn="physicianid" ParentTable="temp_physician" Seed="50"></ForeignKey>
<Derived Name="admission_date" Method="AddRandomDaysToDate" Parameter1="'2007-12-31'" Parameter2="'1000'"/>
<Derived Name="discharge_date" Method="AddRandomDaysToDate" Parameter1="admission_date" Parameter2="'10'"/>
<Derived Name="length_of_stay" Method="DaysDifference" Parameter1="discharge_date" Parameter2="admission_date"/>
<Derived Name="patient_age_at_discharge" Method="YearDifference" Parameter1="discharge_date" Parameter2="patient_dob"/>
<External Name="admitdrg" DataSource="DRGs.txt"/>
<External Name="mortality_level" DataSource="MortalityLevel.txt" SkipHeader="false"/>
<External Name ="severity_level" DataSource="SeverityLevel.txt"/>
<Constant Name="totalcharges" Value="1"/>
<ForeignKey Name="payor_class" ParentColumn="PayerClassCode" ParentTable="Temp_PayerClass"></ForeignKey>
<ForeignKey Name="ADMITTING_PHYSICIAN" ParentColumn="physicianid" ParentTable="temp_physician" Seed="75" IsNullable="true" NullThreshold="0.5"></ForeignKey>
<ForeignKey Name="consulting_physician_1" ParentColumn="physicianid" ParentTable="temp_physician" Seed="1" IsNullable="true" NullThreshold="0.13"></ForeignKey>

event.sHtml:
Hi Brock,
 
There is no code to check in. Copying the xml which will be used to generate the data.
 
<Table Name="temp_discharge" Count="1000">
      <Seq_Int Name="Encounter" Increment="1" MinValue="200"/>
      <Rand_Int Name="Patient" MinValue="1" MaxValue="10000" IsUnique ="true" ></Rand_Int>
      <Seq_Int Name="medical_record_number" Increment="1" MinValue="2000001"/>
      <ForeignKey Name="Hospital" ParentColumn="HospitalName" ParentTable="temp_hospital"></ForeignKey>
      <Derived Name="Entity"  Method="GetReferenceString" Parameter1="'Entity_Code'" Parameter2="'temp_hospital'" Parameter3="'HospitalName'" Parameter4="Hospital"></Derived>
      <Derived Name="Pavilion"  Method="GetReferenceString" Parameter1="'Pavilion_Code'" Parameter2="'temp_hospital'" Parameter3="'HospitalName'" Parameter4="Hospital"></Derived>
      <Derived Name="SubscriberID"  Method="GetValue" Parameter1="Patient"></Derived>
      <Derived Name="patient_name"  Method="Concat" Parameter1="'PatientLast,PatientFirst_'" Parameter2="Patient"></Derived>
      <Seq_Date Name="patient_dob" MinValue="1941-01-01" Increment="1"/>
      <External DataSource="DischargeDisposition.txt" Name="DischargeDisposition"/>
      <ForeignKey Name="discharge_physician" ParentColumn="physicianid" ParentTable="temp_physician" Seed="50"></ForeignKey>
      <Derived Name="admission_date" Method="AddRandomDaysToDate" Parameter1="'2007-12-31'" Parameter2="'1000'"/>
      <Derived Name="discharge_date" Method="AddRandomDaysToDate" Parameter1="admission_date" Parameter2="'10'"/>
      <Derived Name="length_of_stay" Method="DaysDifference" Parameter1="discharge_date" Parameter2="admission_date"/>
      <Derived Name="patient_age_at_discharge" Method="YearDifference" Parameter1="discharge_date" Parameter2="patient_dob"/>

event.evtDescription: Resolved (Needs Review) and assigned to Brock Bouchard by Saurabh Agrawal
event.sHtml:
Hi Brock,
 
There is no code to check in. Copying the xml which will be used to generate the data.
 
<Table Name="temp_cdmcharges" Count="10000">
      <ForeignKey Name="CDM"  ParentColumn="CDM" ParentTable="temp_cdmmaster"/>
      <Rand_Int Name="Quantity" MinValue="1" MaxValue="10"/>
      <Rand_Real Name="TotalCharge" MaxValue="110.5" MinValue="0.5" />
      <ForeignKey Name="EncounterNumber"  ParentColumn="Encounter" ParentTable="temp_discharge"/>
      <Derived Name="ServiceDate" Method="GetDateBetweenColumns" Parameter1="'admission_date'" Parameter2="'discharge_date'" Parameter3="'temp_discharge'" Parameter4="'Encounter'" Parameter5="EncounterNumber"/>
      <Rand_Real Name="TotalCost" MaxValue="110.5" MinValue="0.5" Seed="1"/>
      <Rand_Real Name="CostTotal" MaxValue="110.5" MinValue="0.5" IsNullable="true" Seed="2"/>
      <Rand_Real Name="CostDirect" MaxValue="110.5" MinValue="0.5" IsNullable="true" Seed="3"/>
      <Rand_Real Name="CostVariable" MaxValue="110.5" MinValue="0.5" IsNullable="true" Seed="4"/>
      <Rand_Real Name="CostDirectVariable" MaxValue="110.5" MinValue="0.5" IsNullable="true" Seed="5"/>
      <Rand_Real Name="CostTotalPatient" MaxValue="110.5" MinValue="0.5" IsNullable="true" Seed="6"/>
      <Rand_Real Name="CostTotalVariableSupply" MaxValue="110.5" MinValue="0.5" IsNullable="true" Seed="7"/>
    </Table>

case.sTitle: Implement generator specific validations

event.evtDescription: Assigned to Saurabh Agrawal by Saurabh Agrawal

event.s:
Goal
For each generator, there are certain validations which needs to be passed before data generator kicks off.
1)In case of foreignkeygenerator, both parenttable and parentcolumn attribute must be present.
2) In case of stringgenerator, maximum possible combination for given regular expression should be less than number of records to generate.
event.sChanges: Developer changed from (None) to Saurabh Agrawal Tester changed from (None) to Rajesh Jagadeesan Code Reviewer changed from (None) to Brock Bouchard Status changed from 'New' to 'Assigned'.
event.sHtml:
Goal

For each generator, there are certain validations which needs to be passed before data generator kicks off.

1)In case of foreignkeygenerator, both parenttable and parentcolumn attribute must be present.

2) In case of stringgenerator, maximum possible combination for given regular expression should be less than number of records to generate.

case.sTitle: Add support for switch based validation before data generation process kicks off

event.evtDescription: Assigned to Saurabh Agrawal by Saurabh Agrawal

event.s:
Goal
There are a few validations which are not required every time we generate data. e.g connection string validation, tables existence, columns existence etc.. There should be some switch which can be set to on/off. Validation are only required when we are in development/debugging mode.
event.sChanges: Developer changed from (None) to Saurabh Agrawal Tester changed from (None) to Rajesh Jagadeesan Code Reviewer changed from (None) to Brock Bouchard Status changed from 'New' to 'Assigned'.
event.sHtml:
Goal

There are a few validations which are not required every time we generate data. e.g connection string validation, tables existence, columns existence etc.. There should be some switch which can be set to on/off. Validation are only required when we are in development/debugging mode.

case.sLatestTextSummary: Re-closing after moving to Shared Platform project
case.sTitle: Exception handling : user thrown exception and unhandled system exceptions

event.evtDescription: Assigned to Saurabh Agrawal by Saurabh Agrawal

event.s:
In case of exception either thrown explicitly by the user or system thrown, we need to catch them and show the exception message to the user and exit from the process gracefully.
Instead of using try catch block all over the code, we are just hooking into Application Domain’s “UnhandledException” event and handled it at one place.
event.sChanges: Developer changed from (None) to Saurabh Agrawal Tester changed from (None) to Rajesh Jagadeesan Code Reviewer changed from (None) to Brock Bouchard Status changed from 'New' to 'Assigned'. Milestone changed from 'Undecided' to 'Release CCC.2012.05: 6/30/2012'.
event.sHtml:
In case of exception either thrown explicitly by the user or system thrown, we need to catch them and show the exception message to the user and exit from the process gracefully.

Instead of using try catch block all over the code, we are just hooking into Application Domain’s “UnhandledException” event and handled it at one place.

case.sLatestTextSummary: Re-closing after moving to Shared Platform project
case.sTitle: Data Generator architecture

event.evtDescription: Assigned to Saurabh Agrawal by Saurabh Agrawal

event.s:
After initial discussion and analysis of existing data generator tools (case #36413), we decided to build our own data generator tool. This tool can be used across the products in CRIMSON and will be driven by rules provided in XML file
Above diagram shows the architecture of data generator tool. Below is the high level explanation of each module.
XML: This is an xml file which can be broadly divided into 2 parts
Data Generator Parameters: It contains the parameters like connection string, default number of records per table, Seed for Random data generation etc.
Table details: It contains details of the target tables for which data has to be generated. Table details will include table name, unique constraints, foreign key details, column details with generator specified.
Data Generator Invoker: For now we will have a console application where xml file needs to be feed in as argument. In future however this module can be replaced with UI
Data Generator Engine: This is the core component of data generator tool. It will parse the xml file, read details of each table, assign generator for each column, apply constraints defined in the xml and finally prepares data to be sent to DAL layer
DAL: This layer performs tasks like writing data to db, validating connection string, validating tables etc.
Exception Layer: This contains user defined exceptions divided into 2 groups , Fatal Exception, and Business Exception. Fatal exception is one which cannot be handled by the user and the entire process needs to be halt. Business exceptions are one which can be gracefully handled by the user e.g. table with name “sometable” could not be found.
Logging Layer : This layer basically logs all the actions and exception messages
Entities : These are business entities like Table, Column, Unique Constraint
event.sChanges: Developer changed from (None) to Saurabh Agrawal Tester changed from (None) to Rajesh Jagadeesan Code Reviewer changed from (None) to Brock Bouchard Status changed from 'New' to 'Assigned'. Milestone changed from 'Undecided' to 'Release CCC.2012.05: 6/30/2012'.
event.sHtml:
After initial discussion and analysis of existing data generator tools (case #36413), we decided to build our own data generator tool. This tool can be used across the products in CRIMSON and will be driven by rules provided in XML file

 

Above diagram shows the architecture of data generator tool. Below is the high level explanation of each module.

  1. XML: This is an xml file which can be broadly divided into 2 parts

    Data Generator Parameters: It contains the parameters like connection string, default number of records per table, Seed for Random data generation etc.

    Table details: It contains details of the target tables for which data has to be generated. Table details will include table name, unique constraints, foreign key details, column details with generator specified.

  2. Data Generator Invoker: For now we will have a console application where xml file needs to be feed in as argument. In future however this module can be replaced with UI

  3. Data Generator Engine: This is the core component of data generator tool. It will parse the xml file, read details of each table, assign generator for each column, apply constraints defined in the xml and finally prepares data to be sent to DAL layer

  4. DAL: This layer performs tasks like writing data to db, validating connection string, validating tables etc.

  5. Exception Layer: This contains user defined exceptions divided into 2 groups , Fatal Exception, and Business Exception. Fatal exception is one which cannot be handled by the user and the entire process needs to be halt. Business exceptions are one which can be gracefully handled by the user e.g. table with name “sometable” could not be found.

  6. Logging Layer : This layer basically logs all the actions and exception messages

  7. Entities : These are business entities like Table, Column, Unique Constraint

case.sTitle: Analyze existing data generation tools

event.evtDescription: Assigned to Saurabh Agrawal by Saurabh Agrawal

event.s:
=== GOAL ===
Analyze existing data generation tools (open source/ paid).
=== ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA ===
The data generation tools should support all the requirements listed in the umbrella ticket and should be easy to configure and use.
=== TESTING INSTRUCTIONS ===
This ticket doesn’t require any testing.
=== OPEN QUESTIONS ===
NA
=== TECHNICAL NOTES ===
After looking through blogs and forums it seems “BENERATOR” is the universal choice when it comes to open source and “RED GATE SQL Data Generator” when one is ready to purchase the license.
First I made a POC(attached is the configuration file for temp_hospital, temp_speciality, temp_physician) using “BENERATOR” to check if it fulfills our requirements. Below are my findings.
· Unfortunately this tool doesn’t support direct data population in SQL Server Db and this issue is known to the developer of this tool. In email communication with the developer of this tool, he said we can expect solution in future but no definite timeline. I thought of tweaking the design and instead of populating data directly into tables, first we will generate the csv files and then use our data load process to load the data.
This worked and I could generate csv files in no time for temp_hospital, temp_speciality, temp_physician.
Next challenge was to generate same data each time we run. Unfortunately here also this tool didn’t prove promising. Though it supports seed based data generation but not much documentation/examples can be found. No reply from the tool developer also.
I made a tweak and used a variable when defining the table structure, so that data generated will be same each time we run. But as Brock mentioned we cannot follow this approach as e.g in Discharges table, let’s say there are 10,000 records, and then 10000th record will have LOS as 10000 which don’t sound realistic.
· Next challenge was to generate mapping data in right proportion. e.g, a physician can belong to none or one or more specialty in hospital. With this tool, in the configuration only option for mapping is Cross Product between two table which again didn’t fulfill our requirement.
· BENERATOR expects a configuration files (basically XML file with data generation rules) and this has to be manually written. Looking at the number of csv files we are targeting its tedious to manually write all the xml files. Also maintainability is a big headache as any change in csv file definition or addition of a new csv files requires change in XML.
Red gate sql data generator tools support all the requirements we have for data generation tool, plus it’s easy to use UI is an added advantage. Anyone with knowledge of regular expression can modify the data generation rules in future. We don’t have to worry about schema changes as this tool automatically reads schema information from the database. I created a POC using this tool and loaded the data into Temp_Speciality, Temp_Hospital and Temp_Physician, the quality of data generated was up to mark.

Status changed from 'New' to 'Assigned'. Estimate set to '48 hours' Milestone changed from 'Undecided' to 'Release CCC.2012.05: 6/30/2012'.
event.sHtml:
=== GOAL ===

  Analyze existing data generation tools (open source/ paid).

=== ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA ===

The data generation tools should support all the requirements listed in the umbrella ticket and should be easy to configure and use.

=== TESTING INSTRUCTIONS ===

  This ticket doesn’t require any testing.

=== OPEN QUESTIONS ===

  NA

=== TECHNICAL NOTES ===

After looking through blogs and forums it seems “BENERATOR” is the universal choice when it comes to open source and “RED GATE SQL Data Generator” when one is ready to purchase the license.

First I made a POC(attached is the configuration file for temp_hospital, temp_speciality, temp_physician) using “BENERATOR” to check if it fulfills our requirements. Below are my findings.

·         Unfortunately this tool doesn’t support direct data population in SQL Server Db and this issue is known to the developer of this tool. In email communication with the developer of this tool, he said we can expect solution in future but no definite timeline. I thought of tweaking the design and instead of populating data directly into tables, first we will generate the csv files and then use our data load process to load the data.

               

This worked and I could generate csv files in no time for temp_hospital, temp_speciality, temp_physician.

Next challenge was to generate same data each time we run. Unfortunately here also this tool didn’t prove promising. Though it supports seed based data generation but not much documentation/examples can be found. No reply from the tool developer also.

I made a tweak and used a variable when defining the table structure, so that data generated will be same each time we run. But as Brock mentioned we cannot follow this approach as e.g in Discharges table, let’s say there are 10,000 records, and then 10000th record will have LOS as 10000 which don’t sound realistic.

·         Next challenge was to generate mapping data in right proportion. e.g, a physician can belong to none or one or more specialty in hospital. With this tool, in the configuration only option for mapping is Cross Product between two table which again didn’t fulfill our requirement.

·         BENERATOR expects a configuration files (basically XML file with data generation rules) and this has to be manually written. Looking at the number of csv files we are targeting its tedious to manually write all the xml files. Also maintainability is a big headache as any change in csv file definition or addition of a new csv files requires change in XML.

      Red gate sql data generator tools support all the requirements we have for data generation tool, plus it’s easy to use UI is an added advantage. Anyone with knowledge of regular expression can modify the data generation rules in future. We don’t have to worry about schema changes as this tool automatically reads schema information from the database. I created a POC using this tool and loaded the data into Temp_Speciality, Temp_Hospital and Temp_Physician, the quality of data generated was up to mark.

event.s:
Red Gate tool is licensed one and per user license cost is ~300$. One of our goal is anyone with CCC source code can build the db from code itself without the need of backup and restore. If we go with Red gate tool, we need to procure license for every developer in crimson, which at the moment is not feasible.
So finally we have decided to build our own data generator tool.

Red Gate tool is licensed one and per user license cost is ~300$. One of our goal is anyone with CCC source code can build the db from code itself without the need of backup and restore. If we go with Red gate tool, we need to procure license for every  developer in crimson, which at the moment is not feasible.

So finally we have decided to build our own data generator tool.

case.sTitle: Implement caching to improve performance

event.evtDescription: Assigned to Saurabh Agrawal by Saurabh Agrawal

event.sChanges: Developer changed from (None) to Saurabh Agrawal Tester changed from (None) to Rajesh Jagadeesan Code Reviewer changed from (None) to Brock Bouchard Status changed from 'New' to 'Assigned'.

event.s:
Goal
Implement caching in data generator to improve the performance. Caching can be done for both sql server and external text files.
Resolution :
In .Net 4, we have system.runtime.caching namespace. This is a .net provided caching framework similar to what we had in asp.net.

case.sLatestTextSummary: Moving to Shared Platform project
case.sTitle: Handling Random Seed Problem for each column

event.evtDescription: Assigned to Saurabh Agrawal by Saurabh Agrawal

event.s:
Goal
We started with a singleton "Random" object for each columns in the data generation process. However as per code review Brock realized its not gonna work. Below is the message from Brock :
I was thinking more about Random objects and how seeding works. I am wondering if we need to tweak the design a little bit. If so, we should create a separate ticket to address this.
It seems we have a singleton Random generator that we use everywhere. As tables and columns are added, won’t this adversely affect the consistency of the output? What I mean is that as much as possible we want to generate the same values for a given column over and over again. This is why we seed the Random instance. Code like…
Random random = new Random(100);
for (int i = 0; i < 20; i++)
{
Console.WriteLine(random.Next());
}
… will produce the same numbers every time. However, what if between the creation of the random and when I consume it, I add new code to consume the random? I’ll get different numbers in that loop. I suspect we may have a similar problem when new tables or columns are added to DataGenerator.xml.
As much as possible, we want the data generation process to produce consistent results for a given seed. I thus believe we need to instantiate Random objects per column. Some consequences here:
If we are generating data per row, we’ll either need to switch to per column generation or have some kind of dictionary of columns to Random instances
- Do we specify a single seed and re-use that seed for each column’s Random instance? Or do we accept random seeds per column? If we do that, is it mandatory, or can it override the base seed?
- Quick random thought: I see we hard coded a seed of “100” when building the Random instance. We should avoid “magic values” like this a declare a constant field in the class.
Thoughts?
We discussed this in scrum call and it was a brilliant catch by Brock.
Resolution
Instead of capturing a seed value at application level, we now provide the support to capture seed value at application/table/column level.Table level and column level seeds are optional. In case table level seed is not provided, application level seed will be used. In case column level seed is not provided, table level seed will be used.
Now for each column we construct a seperate "Random" object. Hence the data generated is same each time we run.
event.sChanges: Developer changed from (None) to Saurabh Agrawal Tester changed from (None) to Rajesh Jagadeesan Code Reviewer changed from (None) to Brock Bouchard Status changed from 'New' to 'Assigned'.
event.sHtml:
Goal

We started with a singleton "Random" object for each columns in the data generation process. However as per code review Brock realized its not gonna work. Below is the message from Brock :

 

I was thinking more about Random objects and how seeding works.  I am wondering if we need to tweak the design a little bit.  If so, we should create a separate ticket to address this.

It seems we have a singleton Random generator that we use everywhere.  As tables and columns are added, won’t this adversely affect the consistency of the output?  What I mean is that as much as possible we want to generate the same values for a given column over and over again.  This is why we seed the Random instance.  Code like…

            Random random = new Random(100);

            for (int i = 0; i < 20; i++)

            {

                Console.WriteLine(random.Next());

            }

… will produce the same numbers every time.  However, what if between the creation of the random and when I consume it, I add new code to consume the random?  I’ll get different numbers in that loop.  I suspect we may have a similar problem when new tables or columns are added to DataGenerator.xml.

 As much as possible, we want the data generation process to produce consistent results for a given seed.  I thus believe we need to instantiate Random objects per column.  Some consequences here:

If we are generating data per row, we’ll either need to switch to per column generation or have some kind of dictionary of columns to Random instances

-          Do we specify a single seed and re-use that seed for each column’s Random instance?  Or do we accept random seeds per column?  If we do that, is it mandatory, or can it override the base seed?

-          Quick random thought: I see we hard coded a seed of “100” when building the Random instance.  We should avoid “magic values” like this a declare a constant field in the class.

Thoughts?

We discussed this in scrum call and it was a brilliant catch by Brock.

Resolution

Instead of capturing a seed value at application level, we now provide the support to capture seed value at application/table/column level.Table level and column level seeds are optional. In case table level seed is not provided, application level seed will be used. In case column level seed is not provided, table level seed will be used.

Now for each column we construct a seperate "Random" object. Hence the data generated is same each time we run.

case.sTitle: Handling derived columns

event.evtDescription: Assigned to Saurabh Agrawal by Saurabh Agrawal

event.s:
Goal
Derived columns are those which derives their values from existing column data. e.g LOS is difference between dischargedate and admissiondate.
Resolution :
To support derived column, i have added a partial class of derviedmethods where we pass the parameters defined by the user as Params arg to the respective method. This method is called using reflection so in future we just need to add new methods to this class without changing the code. Number of parameter is limited to 16 at present.
For example :
<Column Name="SpecialtyName" IsDerived="true" Method="Concat" Parameter1="'SpecialtyName_'" Parameter2="SpecialtyCode" />

case.sTitle: Enable support for NULL values

event.evtDescription: Assigned to Saurabh Agrawal by Saurabh Agrawal

event.s:
Goal
There are columns in our db which are of nullable type. e.g Specialty2 column in temp_physician table can have a specialty value or it can be null.
Resolution :
Generate a random number between 0 and 100 and check if the number is prime, if it is a prime number return null from the generator method else return the exact value.
event.sChanges: Developer changed from (None) to Saurabh Agrawal Tester changed from (None) to Rajesh Jagadeesan Code Reviewer changed from (None) to Brock Bouchard Status changed from 'New' to 'Assigned'.

case.sTitle: Apply schema validations for xml file

event.evtDescription: Assigned to Saurabh Agrawal by Saurabh Agrawal

event.s:
We need to validate XML file provided by the user before starting the data generation process. Some of the validation rules used in XSD are listed below:
<ConnectionString> tag is mandatory and should occur only 1 times
<RecordsPerBatch>,<DefaultNumberOfRecords> and <Seed> tags are optional, application will use default value of 1000,100 and 100 respectively
Name attribute in <table> tag is mandatory
Name attribute in <column> tag is mandatory
Every table should contain at least one <column> tag
Count attribute in <table> tag is optional, default value of 100 is used in case it is not specified
event.sChanges: Developer changed from (None) to Saurabh Agrawal Tester changed from (None) to Rajesh Jagadeesan Code Reviewer changed from (None) to Brock Bouchard Status changed from 'New' to 'Assigned'. Milestone changed from 'Undecided' to 'Release CCC.2012.05: 6/30/2012'.
event.sHtml:
We need to validate XML file provided by the user before starting the data generation process. Some of the validation rules used in XSD are listed below:

  1.         <ConnectionString> tag is mandatory and should occur only 1 times
  2.          <RecordsPerBatch>,<DefaultNumberOfRecords> and <Seed>  tags are optional, application will use default value of 1000,100 and 100 respectively
  3.            Name attribute in <table> tag is mandatory
  4.          Name attribute in <column> tag is mandatory
  5.          Every table should contain at least one <column> tag
  6.          Count attribute in <table> tag is optional, default value of 100 is used in case it is not specified

case.sTitle: Add support for variable in data generator

event.evtDescription: Assigned to Saurabh Agrawal by Saurabh Agrawal

event.s:
Goal :
This is indirect way of supporting unique strings in data generator tool. Given a regular expression, its difficult to find the number of possible combinations which can be generated from that regular expression.
One thought was to limit the type of regular expressions supported (e.g support only [0-9][A-Z] and their repetition) but we felt like its better not to limit the regular expressions. To maintain the unique generation of string was a challenge as the third party dll "FARE" returns just a string matching that regular expression at a time. So it might return duplicate strings.
The other solution which clicked our mind was to go with Variable. Anytime we want unique strings we just append this variable at the end of the fixed string supplied by the user.
e.g
<Variable Name="X" Value="1" Increment="1"></Variable>
<Derived Name="PayerClassCode" Method="Concat" Parameter1="'PayerClassCode'" Parameter2="X"/>
The above line will generate distinct PayerClassCode1-20.
event.sChanges: Developer changed from (None) to Saurabh Agrawal Tester changed from (None) to Rajesh Jagadeesan Code Reviewer changed from (None) to Brock Bouchard Status changed from 'New' to 'Assigned'.
event.sHtml:
Goal :

This is indirect way of supporting unique strings in data generator tool. Given a regular expression, its difficult to find the number of possible combinations which can be generated from that regular expression.

One thought was to limit the type of regular expressions supported (e.g support only [0-9][A-Z] and their repetition) but we felt like its better not to limit the regular expressions. To maintain the unique generation of string was a challenge as the third party dll "FARE" returns just a string matching that regular expression at a time. So it might return duplicate strings.

The other solution which clicked our mind was to go with Variable. Anytime we want unique strings we just append this variable at the end of the fixed string supplied by the user.

e.g 

 

<Variable Name="X" Value="1" Increment="1"></Variable>
<Derived Name="PayerClassCode" Method="Concat" Parameter1="'PayerClassCode'" Parameter2="X"/>

 

The above line will generate distinct PayerClassCode1-20.

case.sTitle: .suo and .csproj.user files should not be part of scm

event.evtDescription: Assigned to Kumar Vaibhav by Kumar Vaibhav

event.s:
Description
The .suo and .csproj.user files should not be part of SCM since they have machine\user specific settings.
event.sChanges: Developer changed from (None) to Kumar Vaibhav Tester changed from (None) to Brock Bouchard Code Reviewer changed from (None) to Brock Bouchard Status changed from 'New' to 'Assigned'. Milestone changed from 'Enhancements Backlog' to 'Release CCC.2012.06: 7/20/2012'.
event.sHtml:
Description

The .suo and .csproj.user files should not be part of SCM since they have machine\user specific settings.

case.sTitle: Unify mini profiler and stopwatch reports - both for regressions and slow code and db operations

event.evtDescription: Assigned to Kumar Vaibhav by Kumar Vaibhav

event.s:
Description
In the earlier dummy reports, the regressions reported by mini profiler and stopwatch were separate tables. Same was true for slow code reports. This did not make much sense the user point of view.
Hence, these separate tables have been unified. Now there is just one table for slow code and one table for reporting code regressions.

Hence, these separate tables have been unified. Now there is just one table for slow code and one table for reporting code regressions.

case.sTitle: Adding of classes for Performance reporting of regressions(db\code), slow operations(db\code) and also Math utility

event.evtDescription: Assigned to Kumar Vaibhav by Kumar Vaibhav

event.sChanges: Title changed from 'Add code for Performance reporting. ' to 'Class for Performance reporting of regressions(db\code), slow operations(db\code)'.

event.s: Changing to a more appropriate Case header
event.sChanges: Title changed from 'Class for Performance reporting of regressions(db\code), slow operations(db\code)' to 'Adding of classes for Performance reporting of regressions(db\code), slow operations(db\code) and also Math utility'.
event.sHtml: Changing to a more appropriate Case header

event.s:
Description
The class PerformanceResults has the necessary code for reporting results of a particular profiling session. This class will have the ability to report db regressions, code regressions(for both the mini profiler approach and stopwatch approach), report slow db operations, slow code operations(for both the mini profiler approach and stopwatch approach) and also report the timings for specific operations irrespective of being slow or not. The definition of slowness is, of course, configurable in the system.
For reporting regressions some sort of statistical heuristics were required. If we have a set of data points and we'd like to talk separately talk about some of the points in the dataset in comparison to the other points then z-score is a very useful metric. In our case, we want to talk about the latest response as compared to the previously recorded response times, plus, we also want to record if there is a sudden increase in response times. For the purposes of regression analysis and such statistical heuristics a PerformanceLabsMathUtility class was added.
event.sChanges: Developer changed from (None) to Kumar Vaibhav Tester changed from (None) to Saurabh Agrawal Code Reviewer changed from (None) to Brock Bouchard Status changed from 'New' to 'Resolved (Needs Review)'.
event.evtDescription: Resolved (Needs Review) and assigned to Brock Bouchard by Kumar Vaibhav
event.sHtml:
Description

The class PerformanceResults has the necessary code for reporting results of a particular profiling session. This class will have the ability to report db regressions, code regressions(for both the mini profiler approach and stopwatch approach), report slow db operations, slow code operations(for both the mini profiler approach and stopwatch approach) and also report the timings for specific operations irrespective of being slow or not. The definition of slowness is, of course, configurable in the system.

For reporting regressions some sort of statistical heuristics were required. If we have a set of data points and we'd like to talk separately talk about some of the points in the dataset in comparison to the other points then z-score is a very useful metric. In our case, we want to talk about the latest response as compared to the previously recorded response times, plus, we also want to record if there is a sudden increase in response times. For the purposes of regression analysis and such statistical heuristics a PerformanceLabsMathUtility class was added.

case.sTitle: Generating HTML through code for performance report generation

event.evtDescription: Assigned to Kumar Vaibhav by Kumar Vaibhav

event.s: Adding estimate
event.sChanges: Developer changed from (None) to Kumar Vaibhav Tester changed from (None) to Saurabh Agrawal Code Reviewer changed from (None) to Brock Bouchard Status changed from 'New' to 'Assigned'. Estimate set to '16 hours' Date due changed from (No Date) to 6/16/2012 10:00 AM (GMT-05:00).
event.sHtml: Adding estimate

event.sChanges: Milestone changed from 'Release CCC.2012.05: 6/30/2012' to 'Release CCC.2012.06: 7/23/2012'.

event.s:
Description
Since it was foreseen that in future the reports may get lengthier, there was no point giving out such huge mails to the concerned people. As such, it is better to have some sort of attachment to the mail. The good part about attachments is that they can be archived as well, both on server and on the machines of people getting mails.
A pdf report was contemplated but given the fact that most pdf generation tools are commercial and the free ones don't give much leverage, it was decided to go for an html report. In any case, an html page is any day dynamic than a pdf.
TO generate this report the following components have been used - jquery file, bootstrap css file, bootstrap-responsive css file, modal file and some basic html boilerplate from twitter bootstrap open source project. The resources mentioned have been kept inside the api dll itself as resources and are read when the final report is written.
The report shows a lot of informative stuff - environment statistics, slow db and code operations, db and code regressions, etc.
A sample report is attached.

case.sTitle: Go statement problem while creating database, giving it login credentials and creating the Performance DB related tables from C#

event.evtDescription: Assigned to Kumar Vaibhav by Kumar Vaibhav

event.s:
Description
The GO statement in the table creation string and in the database creation string was creating problems. This is why schema creation was being done manually from the Management Studio through rather than through the PerformanceLabs api code.
Resolution
Since GO is not part of T-Sql and is actually provided by Management Studio for batching of statements there are three ways to deal with it
1. If you really have to use it then use it from a Stored Proc.
2. Use SqlServer Management Studio Object (SMO) that is already provided by SqlServer 2008 R2.
3. Break the query where it has GO and then sequentially run the queries.
The third approach seemed best was taken to fix the code.
event.sChanges: Developer changed from (None) to Kumar Vaibhav Tester changed from (None) to Saurabh Agrawal Code Reviewer changed from (None) to Brock Bouchard Status changed from 'New' to 'Resolved (Needs Review)'.
event.evtDescription: Resolved (Needs Review) and assigned to Brock Bouchard by Kumar Vaibhav
event.sHtml:
Description

The GO statement in the table creation string and in the database creation string was creating problems. This is why schema creation was being done manually from the Management Studio through rather than through the PerformanceLabs api code.

Resolution

Since GO is not part of T-Sql and is actually provided by Management Studio for batching of statements there are three ways to deal with it

1. If you really have to use it then use it from a Stored Proc.

2. Use SqlServer Management Studio Object (SMO) that is already provided by SqlServer 2008 R2.

3. Break the query where it has GO and then sequentially run the queries.

The third approach seemed best was taken to fix the code.

case.sTitle: UX design and markup generation for the Performance Report and linking various related tables through anchors

event.evtDescription: Assigned to Kumar Vaibhav by Kumar Vaibhav

event.sChanges: Category changed from 'Feature' to 'UX Design'.

event.s: Setting estimate
event.sChanges: Dev Reviewer changed from (None) to Brock Bouchard Status changed from 'New' to 'Current'. Estimate set to '16 hours' Date due changed from (No Date) to 6/16/2012 10:00 AM (GMT-05:00).
event.sHtml: Setting estimate

event.sChanges: Milestone changed from 'Release CCC.2012.05: 6/30/2012' to 'Release CCC.2012.06: 7/23/2012'.

event.s:
A sample UI file is attached.
Description
For UI, the open source twitter bootstrap project has been used. The UI is clean and simple. A set of tables report slow db operations, db regressions, slow code operations reported by stopwatch, slow code operations reported by mini profiler, code regressions reported by mini profiler and code regressions reported by stopwatch. In future it will also report specific operations which were meant to be profiled irrespective of their response times.
Use of Modal - If some data, for example, lengthy queries or lengthy stack traces do not seem appropriate to fit in the table data cells then only a portion of them is shown. However, on clicking this(clickable) portion, a modal will open up showing the complete listing. This is very helpful in maintaining a clean and manageable report.
Use of Anchors - Anchors have been used for user navigation and linking related tables. Let's take an example here. A mini profiler profiled code may have db operation involved in it. Hence, a clickable link in the particular row of miniprofiler reported timings will take the user to the corresponding db operation. Now this db operation may have parameters. A clickable link from the particular row of db operation will take the user to the corresponding table showing parameters. This way, full information is meant to be available easily.
So, basically, anything clickable may be worth a try.

In future it will also report specific operations which were meant to be profiled irrespective of their response times. 

Use of Modal - If some data, for example, lengthy queries or lengthy stack traces do not seem appropriate to fit in the table data cells then only a portion of them is shown. However, on clicking this(clickable) portion, a modal will open up showing the complete listing. This is very helpful in maintaining a clean and manageable report.

Use of Anchors - Anchors have been used for user navigation and linking related tables. Let's take an example here. A mini profiler profiled code may have db operation involved in it. Hence, a clickable link in the particular row of miniprofiler reported timings will take the user to the corresponding db operation. Now this db operation may have parameters. A clickable link from the particular row of db operation will take the user to the corresponding table showing parameters. This way, full information is meant to be available easily.

So, basically, anything clickable may be worth a try.

case.sTitle: Query for finding regression results and slow operations.

event.evtDescription: Assigned to Kumar Vaibhav by Kumar Vaibhav
Assigned to Kumar Vaibhav by Brad Thrift

event.s:
Description
The query for finding performance results is a 'get all' query.
For finding slow operations, it first finds out the latest profiling session done. Then it checks the child tables for the corresponding session.
For reporting regressions, all records are fetched leaving the records already reported as regression. This ensures that we do not take into account the response times of previous records otherwise it would lower down the average and standard deviation considerably.
event.sChanges: Developer changed from (None) to Kumar Vaibhav Tester changed from (None) to Saurabh Agrawal Code Reviewer changed from (None) to Brock Bouchard Title changed from 'Query for finding regression results.' to 'Query for finding regression results and slow operations.'. event.sHtml:
Description

The query for finding performance results is a 'get all' query.

For finding slow operations, it first finds out the latest profiling session done. Then it checks the child tables for the corresponding session. 

For reporting regressions, all records are fetched leaving the records already reported as regression. This ensures that we do not take into account the response times of previous records otherwise it would lower down the average and standard deviation considerably.

case.sTitle: Designing the Performance Labs library project, setting up the project, setting up the mvc mini profiler settings.

event.s:
Motivation
Simplicity of use, generic, product independent behavior, accurate logging of results, useful reporting - this has been the primary motive in building this(still evolving) api. The approach taken has been to enable profiling of the code with the least effort possible, which is explained in the 'How to use' section.
Description
This project is meant to be used for profiling of the product's code. The code profiled may be an NUnit project code(which it is initially aiming at) or any other C# code.
This library is generic in nature and product agnostic. It is a wrapper over the open source MVC Mini Profiler project and extends in functionality by also giving out the developers to make use of the Stopwatch to profile code.
The stopwatch used has also been enriched to support a unified approach to profile code. With the stopwatch approach the developers also have the functionality to run a piece of code several times and have the average response time profiled.
The project also provides the functionality to log the results of the profiled code in a separate database. The creation of database, giving it login credentials, creation of various tables in the database is all handled by the library itself. There would be no need to maintain separate files for it nor it would be required to any separate code for ensuring the database existence.
Apart from this, the api also supports functionality for reporting slow code/db operations, code\db regressions through the use of Z-Score and also if some code takes more time as compared to the time it took last time it was profiled based on a configurable multiplication factor. The report also has the functionality to generate and save an html report. It will also have the functionality to profile specific operations irrespective of their response time.
How to use
Initially we are looking at only testing this api with an Nunit project meant for profiling the code in it for performance. Following steps are required -
In Setup.cs of the Nunit project(basically this file contains a class marked with SetupFixture and its methods marked with Setup and Teardown run only once - at the start of project and in the end, respectively )
1. Make an instance of PerformanceLabsLibrary class and call its StartProfilers() method in the Setup marked method of the SetupFixture marked class. This will mock the web context that is required for mvc mini profiler, make default settings, start the mini profiler, ensure db creation\existence.
2. In order to profile any of the code the developer will just need to write something like this a) Taking the mvc mini profiler approach
using(perfLabs.step(Profiler.MVCMiniProfiler, "Name given to piece of code to be profiled")) { ..... piece of code to be profiled ..... }
//saving the profiling results database labs.SaveToDataBase(Profiler.MVCMiniProfiler);
OR
b) Taking the stopwatch approach
using (labs.Step(Profiler.PerfLabsStopWatch, "Name given to piece of code to be profiled", Number_Of_times_to_run, () => { .... code to be profiled })) { }
//saving the profiling results database labs.SaveToDataBase(Profiler.PerfLabsStopWatch);
Note that Number_Of_times_to_run and () => {} are optional, in which case the Number_Of_times_to_run will default to 1 and () => {} will default to null and the developer would just have to mention Profiler.PerfLabsStopWatch as mentioned in a).
3. In the method marked with Teardown attribute simple write the following the following line
labs.StopProfilers();
Quick Test
In order to quickly test the api without setting up any NUnit project, a Helper.cs file has been provided.
1. Make the project a console application by right clicking on the project, selecting its properties and changing its type to 'Console Application'.
2. Just do an F5 to run the Helper.cs. It contains a Main method and some dummy methods to profile that make use of Performance Labs api.
With this approach you can also debug the api.
event.sChanges: Developer changed from (None) to Kumar Vaibhav Tester changed from (None) to Saurabh Agrawal Code Reviewer changed from (None) to Brock Bouchard
event.sHtml:
Motivation

Simplicity of use, generic, product independent behavior, accurate logging of results, useful reporting - this has been the primary motive in building this(still evolving) api. The approach taken has been to enable profiling of the code with the least effort possible, which is explained in the 'How to use' section.

Description

This project is meant to be used for profiling of the product's code. The code profiled may be an NUnit project code(which it is initially aiming at) or any other C# code.

This library is generic in nature and product agnostic. It is a wrapper over the open source MVC Mini Profiler project and extends in functionality by also giving out the developers to make use of the Stopwatch to profile code.

The stopwatch used has also been enriched to support a unified approach to profile code. With the stopwatch approach the developers also have the functionality to run a piece of code several times and have the average response time profiled.

The project also provides the functionality to log the results of the profiled code in a separate database. The creation of database, giving it login credentials, creation of various tables in the database is all handled by the library itself. There would be no need to maintain separate files for it nor it would be required to any separate code for ensuring the database existence.

Apart from this, the api also supports functionality for reporting slow code/db operations, code\db regressions through the use of Z-Score and also if some code takes more time as compared to the time it took last time it was profiled based on a configurable multiplication factor. The report also has the functionality to generate and save an html report. It will also have the functionality to profile specific operations irrespective of their response time.

How to use

Initially we are looking at only testing this api with an Nunit project meant for profiling the code in it for performance. Following steps are required -

In Setup.cs of the Nunit project(basically this file contains a class marked with SetupFixture and its methods marked with Setup and Teardown run only once - at the start of project and in the end, respectively )

1. Make an instance of PerformanceLabsLibrary class and call its StartProfilers() method in the Setup marked method of the SetupFixture marked class. This will mock the web context that is required for mvc mini profiler, make default settings, start the mini profiler, ensure db creation\existence.

2. In order to profile any of the code the developer will just need to write something like this
a) Taking the mvc mini profiler approach


using(perfLabs.step(Profiler.MVCMiniProfiler, "Name given to piece of code to be profiled"))
{
.....
piece of code to be profiled
.....
}

//saving the profiling results database
labs.SaveToDataBase(Profiler.MVCMiniProfiler);

OR

b) Taking the stopwatch approach


using (labs.Step(Profiler.PerfLabsStopWatch, "Name given to piece of code to be profiled", Number_Of_times_to_run, () =>
{ ....
code to be profiled
})) { }

//saving the profiling results database
labs.SaveToDataBase(Profiler.PerfLabsStopWatch);

Note that Number_Of_times_to_run and () => {} are optional, in which case the Number_Of_times_to_run will default to 1 and () => {} will default to null and the developer would just have to mention Profiler.PerfLabsStopWatch as mentioned in a).

3. In the method marked with Teardown attribute simple write the following the following line 

labs.StopProfilers();

Quick Test

In order to quickly test the api without setting up any NUnit project, a Helper.cs file has been provided. 

1. Make the project a console application by right clicking on the project, selecting its properties and changing its type to 'Console Application'.

2. Just do an F5 to run the Helper.cs. It contains a Main method and some dummy methods to profile that make use of Performance Labs api. 

With this approach you can also debug the api.

case.sTitle: Commons - Investigate Enumeration Xml Serilalization

event.s: Enumerations should be able to be serialized using the Serialization attributes. They currently cannot be serialized because the Enumerations have no default constructor. An investigation into the XmlSerializer needs to be done to allow these values to be serialized into XML without having to create custom Serializers for all containing classes.
event.sHtml: Enumerations should be able to be serialized using the Serialization attributes.  They currently cannot be serialized because the Enumerations have no default constructor.  An investigation into the XmlSerializer needs to be done to allow these values to be serialized into XML without having to create custom Serializers for all containing classes.
