case.sTitle: SchemaUtil throws exception when removing Queues

event.evtDescription: Assigned to Asad Moin by Michael Glasgow

event.s:
features must contain the following information : BUSINESS VALUE:
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA:
DATA NEEDED/MIGRATION/LOADER UPDATES:
TESTING INSTRUCTIONS:
TECHNICAL NOTES:
event.evtDescription: Assigned to Michael Glasgow by Heather Noe
event.sHtml:
features must contain the following information :
BUSINESS VALUE:

ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA:

DATA NEEDED/MIGRATION/LOADER UPDATES:

TESTING INSTRUCTIONS:

TECHNICAL NOTES:

event.s:
BUSINESS VALUE:
Product teams are beginning to make use of the Service Broker features of MS SQL Server. SchemaUtil needs to properly export and migrate Service Broker objects so that the standard SchemaUtil process can be used in rolling out products that make use of these features.
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA:
Case 1 - exporting of Service Broker objects
* Create a queue and a service tied to this queue in SQL Server.
* Use SchemaUtil to export the schema.
* A file should be created to create the queue and service and be placed under the schema/Service Broker directory.
Case 2 - migrating of Service Broker objects
* Delete queues and services from the database.
* Using the scripts from Case 1, run SchemaUtil /migrate
* Both the queue and service should be created in the database
Case 3 - Removal of service broker objects that are not part of schema
* Create an additional queue and service in the databases
* Using the scripts from Case 1, run SchemaUtil /migrate
* Only the original queue and service should exist in the database, the additional objects should be deleted.
DATA NEEDED/MIGRATION/LOADER UPDATES:
This will have no affect on DataLoader or Migration.
TESTING INSTRUCTIONS:
TECHNICAL NOTES:
event.sChanges: Estimate set to '16 hours'
event.sHtml:
BUSINESS VALUE:

Product teams are beginning to make use of the Service Broker features of MS SQL Server.  SchemaUtil needs to properly export and migrate Service Broker objects so that the standard SchemaUtil process can be used in rolling out products that make use of these features.


ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA:

Case 1 - exporting of Service Broker objects

   * Create a queue and a service tied to this queue in SQL Server.

   * Use SchemaUtil to export the schema.

   * A file should be created to create the queue and service and be placed under the schema/Service Broker directory.

 

Case 2 - migrating of Service Broker objects

   * Delete queues and services from the database.

    * Using the scripts from Case 1, run SchemaUtil /migrate

    * Both the queue and service should be created in the database

 

Case 3 - Removal of service broker objects that are not part of schema

   * Create an additional queue and service in the databases

   * Using the scripts from Case 1, run SchemaUtil /migrate

   * Only the original queue and service should exist in the database, the additional objects should be deleted.

 


DATA NEEDED/MIGRATION/LOADER UPDATES:

This will have no affect on DataLoader or Migration.


TESTING INSTRUCTIONS:

TECHNICAL NOTES:

event.sChanges: Status changed from 'New' to 'Assigned'. Milestone changed from 'Undecided' to 'SchemaUtil.2012.xx: 6/30/2012'.

Title changed from 'Add support to SchemaUtil for Queues and Services' to 'SchemaUtil throws exception when removing Queues'. Category changed from 'Feature' to 'Bug'. Status changed from 'Assigned' to 'New'. Estimate changed from '16 hours' to '2 hours'.
event.evtDescription: Assigned to Asad Moin by Michael Glasgow

event.s:
This ticket has been changed to a bug. SchemaUtil supports Queues and Services, it was ignoring Services when looking for differences because they are not associated with a schema. So, they were failing the schema inclusion check and were not being removed. Since these are tied to a queue, the queue cannot be removed until the service is, so it was throwing an exception.
Added a check so that if it's a Service then the schema inclusion check is not performed.
event.sHtml:
This ticket has been changed to a bug.  SchemaUtil supports Queues and Services, it was ignoring Services when looking for differences because they are not associated with a schema.  So, they were failing the schema inclusion check and were not being removed.  Since these are tied to a queue, the queue cannot be removed until the service is, so it was throwing an exception.

Added a check so that if it's a Service then the schema inclusion check is not performed.

case.sLatestTextSummary: Re-closing after moving to Shared Platform project
case.sTitle: SchemaUtil update to support schema whitelist

event.s:
Recent changes to SchemaUtil only consider tables which are part of the [dbo] schema. This breaks SchemaUtil for CPM team as it employs a few different schemas (i.e. geo, computed, etc.)
Update SchemaUtil to:
read from a whitelist file to find the set of schemas that are tracked (dbo will always be tracked regardless)
if no whitelist, default to only tracking tables that are part of dbo schema
In the end, SchemaUtil will:
ignore any tables which are part of schemas that are NOT defined in the whitelist file
Note to Dev
SchemaUtil current supports a SchemaMetaData.csv file which it reads and populates dbo.SchemaMetaData with. So that we don't have to config related files sitting around, we should consider unify the csv file and the schema whitelist file into an xml file.
event.sHtml:
Recent changes to SchemaUtil only consider tables which are part of the [dbo] schema. This breaks SchemaUtil for CPM team as it employs a few different schemas (i.e. geo, computed, etc.)

Update SchemaUtil to:

  • read from a whitelist file to find the set of schemas that are tracked (dbo will always be tracked regardless)
  • if no whitelist, default to only tracking tables that are part of dbo schema

In the end, SchemaUtil will:

  • ignore any tables which are part of schemas that are NOT defined in the whitelist file

Note to Dev

SchemaUtil current supports a SchemaMetaData.csv file which it reads and populates dbo.SchemaMetaData with. So that we don't have to config related files sitting around, we should consider unify the csv file and the schema whitelist file into an xml file.

case.sTitle: SchemaUtil throws exception if SchemaMetaData.csv is empty

event.s:
If the SchemaMetaData.csv file exists, but has no name value pairs in it, SchemaUtil throws an exception when it tries to send an empty string as a SQL command.
Need to add a check to MetaDataService so that if the file contains no valid records, no meta data is inserted into the database.
To reproduce:
Create a file called SchemaMetaData.csv under the schema directory.
The file should exist, but contain no records.
Run SchemaUtil with /action:migrate option
The schema should be migrated as normal and a message should be displayed indicating that SchemaMetaData.csv has no key/value pairs.
event.sHtml:
If the SchemaMetaData.csv file exists, but has no name value pairs in it, SchemaUtil throws an exception when it tries to send an empty string as a SQL command.

Need to add a check to MetaDataService so that if the file contains no valid records, no meta data is inserted into the database.

To reproduce:

  1. Create a file called SchemaMetaData.csv under the schema directory.  
  2. The file should exist, but contain no records.
  3. Run SchemaUtil with /action:migrate option
  4. The schema should be migrated as normal and a message should be displayed indicating that SchemaMetaData.csv has no key/value pairs.

case.sLatestTextSummary: Closing after moving to Shared Platform project
case.sTitle: ServiceLayerLib Improvements

event.s:
Problem
ServiceLayerLib needs to be simpler to consume. Right now it requires a full-fledged implementation of IServiceLayerIocContainer that is backed by an IoC tool like StructureMap. This is a bad requirement as some projects may not have or need that.
Solution
I have come up with a default implementation of IServiceLayerIocContainer that relies upon default constructors. It also provides a way to register the technology-agnostic service implementations. See the commit comments below.
event.sHtml:
Problem

ServiceLayerLib needs to be simpler to consume.  Right now it requires a full-fledged implementation of IServiceLayerIocContainer that is backed by an IoC tool like StructureMap.  This is a bad requirement as some projects may not have or need that.

Solution

I have come up with a default implementation of IServiceLayerIocContainer that relies upon default constructors.  It also provides a way to register the technology-agnostic service implementations.  See the commit comments below.

case.sTitle: Fix container abstractions to prevent service locator pattern

event.s:
In the SiteManagerBrock branch we are currently able to execute code like IocContainer.Currrent.GetInstance() anywhere in the code. Not only is this bad practice (http://blog.ploeh.dk/2010/09/29/TheRegisterResolveReleasePattern.aspx), but with the new web service architecture dictated by ServiceLayerLib, there is no way of getting at the nested container currently in scope.
We thus need to remove the ability to call IocContainer.Current. This will involve:
- Making IIocContainer injectable
- Using the dependency injection abstractions in MVC 3
event.sHtml:
In the SiteManagerBrock branch we are currently able to execute code like IocContainer.Currrent.GetInstance() anywhere in the code.  Not only is this bad practice (http://blog.ploeh.dk/2010/09/29/TheRegisterResolveReleasePattern.aspx), but with the new web service architecture dictated by ServiceLayerLib, there is no way of getting at the nested container currently in scope.

We thus need to remove the ability to call IocContainer.Current.  This will involve:

- Making IIocContainer injectable

- Using the dependency injection abstractions in MVC 3

case.sLatestTextSummary: Closing after moving to Shared Platform project
case.sTitle: Improve ServiceLayerLib exception handling

event.s:
The ServiceLayerLib exception handling paradigm
ServiceLayerLib generates code that results in a "business" or "internal" exception on the client. The code generator is given a list of business exceptions, and when those exceptions occur in the generated services, their messages are passed along to the client.
The idea is that business exceptions are those whose message should be passed along to the end user (e.g. "the selected physician does not have any data for this measure")
Some things to fix
- There is no need to generate the BusinessExceptionFault and InternalException fault classes. We can just declare those in ServiceLayerLib and reference them directly.
- When executing filters, we should be sure to propgate a ServiceLayerInternalException. Right now, in the case of WCF filters, the generic fault exception is being thrown instead. In the future it would be nice to propage business exceptions executed by the filters, although that will require some work. We'll see if that requirement ever comes up.
event.sHtml:
The ServiceLayerLib exception handling paradigm

ServiceLayerLib generates code that results in a "business" or "internal" exception on the client.  The code generator is given a list of business exceptions, and when those exceptions occur in the generated services, their messages are passed along to the client.

The idea is that business exceptions are those whose message should be passed along to the end user (e.g. "the selected physician does not have any data for this measure")

Some things to fix

- There is no need to generate the BusinessExceptionFault and InternalException fault classes.  We can just declare those in ServiceLayerLib and reference them directly.

- When executing filters, we should be sure to propgate a ServiceLayerInternalException.  Right now, in the case of WCF filters, the generic fault exception is being thrown instead.  In the future it would be nice to propage business exceptions executed by the filters, although that will require some work.  We'll see if that requirement ever comes up.

event.evtDescription: Assigned to Brock Bouchard by Brock Bouchard

case.sTitle: Organize relevant existing SiteManager code into "Web" projects

event.s:
The purpose of this ticket is to capture changes related to splitting the SiteManager codebase into a thin web application talking to a "site manager platform" of web services. This ticket focuses on the creation and organization of the former.
Note that there are a large number of changesets here, and the result of the work done here will leave the SiteManager in an un-deployable state. The changes necessary to transform this architecture are going to be just too complicated to break down into 2 day tickets and follow the usual process. I just needed a ticket to capture changesets against while I am heads down banging away against code. I will ultimately follow up with other developers to review and test the architecture changes.

case.sTitle: Improve and Abstract WCF-related code

event.s:
The purpose of this ticket is to capture changes related to abstracting WCF code. This was done by creating a "ServiceLayerLib" and accompanying code generator. The former contains code to help configure WCF, and the latter generates WCF code from plain old .NET interfaces and DTOs.
Note that there are a large number of changesets here, and the result of the work done here will leave the SiteManager in an un-deployable state. The changes necessary to transform this architecture are going to be just too complicated to break down into 2 day tickets and follow the usual process. I just needed a ticket to capture changesets against while I am heads down banging away against code. I will ultimately follow up with other developers to review and test the architecture changes.

Note that there are a large number of changesets here, and the result of the work done here will leave the SiteManager in an un-deployable state. The changes necessary to transform this architecture are going to be just too complicated to break down into 2 day tickets and follow the usual process. case.sLatestTextSummary: Closing after moving to Shared Platform project
case.sTitle: Add support for domain names to SiteManager servers

event.s:
Currently, SiteManager restricts users to entering IP addresses when creating servers. We need to allow users to be able specify domain names of servers as well. The details:
- Both IP addresses and domain names should be supported
- When validating the server we should check that address (domain name or IP address) is valid. We'll want to abstract this check to the Infrastructure library so the validation class in domain can easily be unit tested.
- Some server addresses will be SQL Server instances, e.g. SomeSqlServer\SomeInstance. We need to be able to handle that situation as well.
event.sHtml:
Currently, SiteManager restricts users to entering IP addresses when creating servers.  We need to allow users to be able specify domain names of servers as well.  The details:

- Both IP addresses and domain names should be supported

- When validating the server we should check that address (domain name or IP address) is valid.  We'll want to abstract this check to the Infrastructure library so the validation class in domain can easily be unit tested.

- Some server addresses will be SQL Server instances, e.g. SomeSqlServer\SomeInstance.  We need to be able to handle that situation as well.

event.evtDescription: Assigned to Navpreet Singh by Brock Bouchard

case.sLatestTextSummary: Closing after moving to Shared Platform project
case.sTitle: Add ability to restart a site in SiteManager

event.s:
In SiteManager there should be the ability to restart an individual member site.
In the UI, we'll add the option as a link in the pop-up edit menu (just under the uninstall link).
In the code, we'll add a restart method to IWebDeploymentService to recycle the application pool.
event.sHtml:
In SiteManager there should be the ability to restart an individual member site.

In the UI, we'll add the option as a link in the pop-up edit menu (just under the uninstall link).

In the code, we'll add a restart method to IWebDeploymentService to recycle the application pool.

case.sTitle: Adding entry to PRODUCTS table for Realtime Readmissions product

event.s: Adding entry to PRODUCTS table for Realtime Readmissions product
event.sHtml: Adding entry to PRODUCTS table for Realtime Readmissions product

event.evtDescription: Assigned to Asad Moin by Mitchell Morris

event.s:
Making changes per email:
To add CRT to SiteManager you’ll need to do 2 things:
1. Add a database migration to the source code to insert a record in the Products table: a. Download the site manager source and build it per the instructions on the wiki b. Add a database migration via /SiteManager.Database/HelperScripts/CreateMigration.bat in the SiteManager source tree c. Please create a ticket for this work and add me as code reviewer 2. Create a CRT build script that outputs the web application package to our build artifacts: a. The build artifacts are located at \\192.168.16.58\BuildArtifacts b. You’ll need a build script that outputs a web deploy package to \\192.168.16.58\BuildArtifacts\[CRT_Product_BuildArtifactName]\[ReleaseName]\[BuildNumber]\ [CRT_Product_BuildArtifactName]_[ReleaseName]_[BuildNumber].zip c. Refer to the CCC packaging build script at /Build/Packaging/ClinicalAdvantage.proj in the CCC source tree
This is kind of the 10,000 foot view of what needs to get done. The SiteManager change should be pretty quick and I can answer questions about that over Skype (my id is advisorybrock). The build script thing will probably take longer. Any of the product teams should be able to helper you there (CCC, CMA, CPM). In particular the CCI team is just going through this whole process as well. You might want to talk to Prabhuram Jagadeesan for help as it will be fresh in his mind.
event.sChanges: Status changed from 'New' to 'Assigned'.
event.evtDescription: Assigned to Mitchell Morris by Mitchell Morris
event.sHtml:
Making changes per email:


To add CRT to SiteManager you’ll need to do 2 things:
 
1.      Add a database migration to the source code to insert a record in the Products table:
a.      Download the site manager source and build it per the instructions on the wiki
b.      Add a database migration via /SiteManager.Database/HelperScripts/CreateMigration.bat in the SiteManager source tree
c.      Please create a ticket for this work and add me as code reviewer
2.      Create a CRT build script that outputs the web application package to our build artifacts:
a.      The build artifacts are located at \\192.168.16.58\BuildArtifacts
b.      You’ll need a build script that outputs a web deploy package to \\192.168.16.58\BuildArtifacts\[CRT_Product_BuildArtifactName]\[ReleaseName]\[BuildNumber]\ [CRT_Product_BuildArtifactName]_[ReleaseName]_[BuildNumber].zip
c.      Refer to the CCC packaging build script at /Build/Packaging/ClinicalAdvantage.proj in the CCC source tree
 
This is kind of the 10,000 foot view of what needs to get done.  The SiteManager change should be pretty quick and I can answer questions about that over Skype (my id is advisorybrock).  The build script thing will probably take longer.  Any of the product teams should be able to helper you there (CCC, CMA, CPM).  In particular the CCI team is just going through this whole process as well.  You might want to talk to Prabhuram Jagadeesan for help as it will be fresh in his mind.
